title: Excellent hotel staff makes for an excellent stay
review: we arrive at friday by car ...no body tell us you not alowed to get that area with car ..they send us to a parking belong to the HOTEL they charge 30 euro per day...spoke with friends that sleep at the area they pay in a public park 10 euro a day.. then we get a room second floor call a junior suite.. the room was funny the bed is upster need to walk up little hard stairs... i ask to be change no body care at from office .... tv didint work at all ...no also a litle light next to bed ... he was so hot at night try to open the window was a heavy one..no air... breakfast very continental ....no much choice .... the bellboy was very nice also the gil at front office but the guy who run the front office didint care about our needs... they charge turist tax per night ..extra 1euro to get permissionto park etc... nice locacion. internet very bad coneccion next room we have a family one child jumping and making noice ....…

title: Unusual, but very good.
review: It's a bit off the beaten path, about a 25 minute walk from the Unita train station.  This is not a bad thing, as you walk out the door and are not greeted by the rush of people walking by.  As other reviewers write, if you want to sleep in a bit of history, this is probably the right place, with some of the original frescoes still intact.  But for me, the staff really made our stay in Florence enjoyable.  They were friendly, attentive, and prompt.  They happily carried our bags up the stairs.  They greeted us in the morning for breakfast.  They got us (Americans :) ice when we wanted it.  My partner needs an electric fan to sleep and they happily accommodated that request.  When we checked in, the staff member asked us if this was our first time and when we said yes, she opened up a map and highlighted where everything was relative to our hotel.  And even though we had booked a junior suite, we got upgraded to a full suite.  All of this is to say that the staff made us feel very welcome and special.…

title: Very convenient location
review: This hotel must be unique. It's in a building which is reputed to be over 500 years old, and retains many of the original features and atmostphere. This is in some ways this makes it great for a stay in the historic city of Florence, and its location is ideal for visiting many of the attractions on foot.  The age of the building does detract a little if what you want are all the conveniences of modern Hotel (there are no lifts and narrow winding stairs to the upper floors for example.) The room we had was comfortably furnished in a style in keeping with the building and the bathroom excellent. Mini bar, wifi and other services very good although the TV had no access to English speaking channels. Due to the architecture, a little dark. The staff were exceptional,  always welcoming and very helpful and made our short stay most enjoyable. Breakfast was pretty standard continental but good in the small dining room. Unfortunately the weather was bad during our stay, as there is a very attractive open courtyard which must be idylic in better conditions. In summary the Hotel is small, welcoming, and full of atmostphere, well located for a short stay. "Historic House" describes it perfectly.…

title: An "interesting" place to stay
review: Very friendly and welcoming staff. a quiet location but within easy walking distance to Duomo and Santa Crocce. Comfortable rooms and an unique historic building . Breakfast  was fresh, meats and cheeses . Staff were very helpful

review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. title: NIGHTMARE!! Its a lie!!
review: J and J Hotel is a great boutique hotel a few blocks from Santa Croce and The Duomo on a quiet street. The staff are friendly and welcoming. The bed is comfortable, and there are an assortment of pillows. The bathroom was very nice, spacious, and clean.We stayed in a very spacious suite. It was a great place to relax after several hours of touring the city. Breakfast is included, and it has great hot and cold selections, including espresso and cappuccino.

title: Cosy place
review: Compare the pictures to the web   - Tell me if this is a room for 3 (suposed to be a junior suite!!! Not an standard room!! So i cant imagine how an stardard room was...   -  tell me if this is to pay 390€/night - You dont have wardrobe - look at the Window views PLEASE!!  See the pictures and read (dont go! Is horrible!)  When you complain they tell you they dont give your money back and that you cant talk to the director  A blonde woman in de reception desk i think her ñame was rebeca, told me that if i wanted to write a letter to the director she would break it in peaces just in the minute i would leave!!  We lost 900euros and they were so rude!!

title: Not as expected
review: Located just about 300-400 yards from the Doumo, sits on a very quiet street (opposite the police station) but next to the busy street with loads of cafes, restaurants and shops - this was the perfect location for our week in Florence! Very friendly multilingual staff, nice fresh breakfast and delicious coffee every morning, bar at evenings - anything to accommodate a nice stay. Our room was with clean on-suit, large bed and other convenient futures including a safe. There was a door to the small courtyard with plants and tables as well.  We had clean fluffy towels every day and bedding swap in a middle of the week too.  The building apparently is XVI century monastery converted in a hotel and you will see some historical futures left once you enter.  Lovely place, we really…

title: Central with amazing rooms. Fab
review: The room was very disappointing. It did not meet our expectation. It is not what I would expect from a 4 star hotel (we normally stay at 4 star hotels during our trips and we are used to better rooms) .The furniture looked old and worn. The bed made noises with every movement and the mattresses were uncomfortable. Breakfast was also poorly (small selection and not very appealing presentation of food - cheese and sausage were served on wooden plates and didn't look appetizing. The cups were partly chipped on the edges).

title: Great hotel in een great town
review: My husband and I stayed here for 7 nights beautiful place.bed was so comfortable.very clean.and it was central to all the sights on our bucket list.i would recommend it very much.staff were very friendly and helpful.would definitely go back.

title: Beautiful room
review: Very friendly staff, great sphere in een very uniek town. Perfect match for this town. If I visit Florence again I would choose this hotel one more time. I recommend to everyone. The room was spacious, watch out for bugs in old building bugs needs extra attention.

title: Exceeded expectations in Firenze!
review: We stayed in one of the suites, and it was wonderful - high ceilings, great layout and decor, great atmosphere overall. The location is good, a short walk to lots of the most beautiful spots. The property is nice and was a good respite from the heat when we came back for a quick stop. Staff were friendly and accommodating. Breakfast was decent but not out of this world, very nice coffee though. This was one of our mini-moon destinations and we were very happy with it, very romantic. The only downside was the floor vibrated a bit when the upstairs guests were walking around -- historic wood building -- but didn't really impact sleeping and it was a clean, quiet room. I guess there were a few steps to climb to get to the room, but that was totally fine for us.  The only other…

title: A slice of Tuscan tradition
review: Wow! Where to start? We had an amazing experience in this hotel.   Our group  We are traveling with our two adult sons aged 25 & 22.   Arrival  We arrived to Firenze by train and walked to the hotel in about 25 minutes. The hotel is just a couple of blocks past the Cathedral of Santa María del Fiore in a beautiful quiet street.   Check-in We were greeted by Martina in the lobby/reception. It is a beautiful historical building and very tastefully decorated. She was very nice and registered us promptly. She gave us a city map and some recommendations for some things that we needed. She also got us an electrical current adapter to charge our phones which was very helpful and appreciated.   Our rooms Who got two rooms next to each other on the ground floor in the rear. Our sons…

title: All around good stay
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Beyond dissatisfied
review: Stayed here for 5 night and I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. The free breakfast was very nice. The staff are great and can speak English which helped because I'm Irish. They were on hand to give me any information I needed to enjoy my stay in Florence and I owe a lot of thanks to them for my wonderful stay.  Would recommend

title: NOt really what I expected
review: So I booked this for two nights for my wife and I. It was our first getaway without our kids in a long while. I booked the most expensive room they had with the intention of getting a room with a nice tub, a nice porch for us to relax on and what not. When we got to our room it had neither of those amenities. What it did have was stains, smell, and overall looking like it needed some real cleaning.   When they switched us to a room with a tub and porch (real small and useless) that room had real week AC and anytime we would walk or the people above us, the entire room would shake.  Our bathroom as well was unventilated and was hot like a sauna.  Overall I would never stay here again and not recommend it to anyone.

title: Really Enjoyed Our Stay
review: Dear LevyHertzel,             We thank you very much for staying at the J and J Hotel and for taking your time sharing your experience with us. We are extremely very sorry that you were unsatisfied with the accomodation. As the building was an old convent of the 16th century, all our rooms are different from each other that is why we prefer to receive any special request at the time of the reservation. Hence we agree that there was some issue with the AC, however those days Florence was under a 42°C heat wave. Consequently this was giving some problem to the whole system which hopefully we were able to resolve later. Thank you again and we apologize for all the inconvenience caused. Warmest regards The Management

title: Beautiful, romantic and quaint!
review: We have been given a very shabby room, originally we were given room nr 6 but when we wlaked in it was soooo smelly of smoke we could hardly breathe. At the reception they said it is forbidden to smoke in all rooms but sometimes happens... right I understand that but why the housekeeping team did not do anything to make the smell go away ? why did they not even open the windows? why did they not advise the front desk about the smelly room ?  In exchange we have been given room nr 20 with the guarantee that is was the same category of room 6 .... not a chance in the world....!!! Room 20 is a shack, all walls are dirty and very badly maintened, yello spots bbelow the a/c system, dirty floor (my white socks where black in 2 minutes), tiles in the bathroom falling apart ... really…

title: not the best
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. title: Excellent quality room but noisy guests
review: We stayed three nights at this hotel and the best thing about it its the location. It was an old convent and there is no elevator so to reach our room we had to climb two steep flights of stone stairs. The room was a large quad with one small air conditioning unit on the wall which barely kept the room cool and which would turn off in the middle of the night. The staff was business like and competent. The breakfast was ok, but the coffee was usually burnt. the wait staff in the breakfast area were very nice and you could smell fresh croissants baking in the early morning. they tried!

title: Wonderful Stay
review: Dear Valued customer,                           We thank you very much for choosing our hotel for your stay in Florence and for sharing your experience with us. We are very sorry that you were not too satisfied with the hotel. Yes you are perfectly right, the building was an old convent of the 16th century converted into a hotel, that is why it's particular from the other standard hotels. We don't have a lift as we are not allowed by the council to put one. As mentioned above, it is a historical building and preserved as cultural heritage so no modifications can be done.  Anyway we hope that this has not put you off for a next visit. We look forward to welcoming you in the future. Have a nice day Warmest regards The Management

title: Location Location Location
review: This hotel was beautifully decorated. The hotel room was spacious and the bed extremely comfortable. The hotel is in a quadrangle so noise travels from the quadrangle up into the rooms. Because from 4pm to 5pm there was a huge commotion between a couple,  and a huge fight erupted, it sounded like someone was going to be thrown off the balcony and killed, and we invisioned police arriving. The hotel staff did not ask them to be quiet or to refrain from shouting and making a loud noise until we phoned reception to find out what was happening. The guy eventually left the hotel but came back at 11.39pm and the couple started having a shouting match again.  The hotel staff did not stop him until we phoned to say he was keeping us awake with the shouting , and it was totally…

title: Definitely not a 4-star experience
review: Dear LeazieK,                  We thank you very much for choosing the J and J hotel for your stay in Florence and also for sharing your experience with us. We are glad to know that you found the hotel nice and you loved your accomodation a lot. .  Our sincere apologies regarding the noisy couple that was staying just next to your room. It's not that we haven't tried to calm them. The reception staff already intervened when they were discussing in the lobby area however when they continued to fight in the room, it's quite impossible for us to hear that due to the distance. As soon as you informed us, the night manager called them back immediately although it was hard to make them understand as they were drunk. Sincerely we have never experienced such kind of issue in the past as it never happened before and that's why the staff hesitated to call the police. We apologize for all the inconvenience caused.  Concerning the breakfast, we apologize for this as well as certainly there have been some kind of misunderstandings. Our buffet is opened to all our guests but as we told you that morning, we don't have take away cups for coffee or special containers to pack food. Guests are free to take away fruits or croissants if they have their own bag.  Thank you and have a nice day Warmest regards The Management.

title: Not what I expected
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. title: Character building, excellent staff
review: I had booked a suite so we would have space to relax in our room. The room was a shock when we saw it. It is entered by a small entrance hall off which is a very average bathroom with miniscule bath. The access to the bath is very difficult and not at all comfortable to use. Then there is a sleep stone staircase and a long landing before you reach a tiny sitting area with a two seat sofa and two stools. This area is cramped and not suite standard. Then its down a few more stairs to the bedroom area. Its a long treck to the toilet from the bed! We complained immediately that this was not our idea of a comfortable relaxing suite but were told the hotel was full and there was nothing that could be done. The suites are advertised as fitting up to 4 adults. I cant imagine where they…

title: Room 20 is just fine
review: Dear Sir/Madam,                      Thank you very much for choosing the J and J Hotel and for taking your time sharing your experience with us. We are very sorry that you were not satisfied about the room and moreover we were unable to move you into another one due to unavailability. Having said that, we would like to precise that room number 19 is a beautiful Double Split level Suite with a small terrace, of course different from the other Suites that we have. We keep saying to our guests that the building was once a convent converted into a hotel and that's the reason why some rooms are different from the others even if they are from the same category. Images and information can be found on our official website. Concerning Family Suites you are right that we have advertised having Suites that can perfectly accomodate up to 4 adults but it's obvious that Suite 19 is NOT for 4 people. Your booking was for 2 people and you were assigned into a Double Suite.  Suites for 4 people are of course different, much more spacious to accomodate comfortably up to 4 adults.  Hoping that we have answered everything, we thank you very much and we wish a you a nice evening. Kind regards The Management

title: Historic Florence
review: Stayed here for three nights. great base to explore Florence - about a 10 minute work from Il Duomo. The room we had was a little basic but very comfortable. The building itself has a lot of character, and is nicely laid out. Best thing about this place was the staff, they could not have been more friendly and helpful

title: Not as expected and pictured
review: Dear 588Lighthouse,            We thank you very much for choosing the J and J Hotel for your stay in florence and for sharing your beautiful experience with us. We are very glad to know that you love the hotel and enjoyed your stay. A big thanks from the entire staff as well and we look forward for your next stay.  Have a nice day. Kind regards The Management

title: A shabby hotel in need of investment that serves coffee in a teapot!
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. title: Good location, great breakfast, kind service
review: We were thoroughly disappointed in this hotel. Our initial booking of a deluxe room was upgraded on arrival to a "suite" (room 4) basically a large room with shabby furniture and a outdated bathroom with no proper shower just a hose attached to the taps. The only window looked over the central internal courtyard and the main passage way for guests to access their rooms so you either had to have the curtains closed all the time or open for everyone passing by to see in.  We were so dissatisfied  we asked for our original deluxe room, that we had booked back in January. The only one that was available(allegedly) was room 20 and be aware that this room is ABSOLUTELY nothing like the rooms on the hotel website. It is painted completely white (dirty marks everywhere), no pictures or…

title: Amazing!
review: Dear Joanne,  We thank you very much for booking the J and J Hotel and furthermore for sharing your stay with us. We are extremely very sorry about your bad experience but at the same time surprised about all these complains that you have mentioned. First of all when we normally offer a free upgrade from a standard room to one of a higher level, 99.9% of our guests feel amazed however you were the very first guest that was totally unhappy and starting complaining with the hotel staff... Whenever we have the possibility, this is a kind of promotion that we offer, in accordance with the travel agents,to  our guests.  The building itself was originally a convent of the 15th century and then converted into a hotel, so it’s quite normal to have rooms different from each other. Of course it’s quite impossible to put all the pictures of all the 21 rooms on the website. Whenever a guest is not happy with his room, we try our best to give an alternative one however this of course will depend on our availability. Your complain arrived on the second day of your stay and that particular day, we had just a couple of rooms available. The hotel staff informed you that it was no more possible to make a second change as another Deluxe room was not available. The availability that you saw online was for different categories.  The fact that you don’t like rooms number 4 or 20 is your personal opinion and we respect it but it’s not nice to recommend other guests not to book them. We have many returning guests when  usually make their reservation, ask for these rooms to be assigned them. All the rooms are equipped with antique furnitures (not old) and concerning the bath of being too high, well it’s a normal bathtub with normal/standard dimensions. The purpose of offering you a bottle of spumante was not done in the hope to avoid any written complain…... This was specially requested by your travel agent.  Our main goal is to make our guests happy, by making them feel comfortable, by offering full assistance, service, and respect. If a guest has an issue, the staff is here purposely to listen and give assistance as soon as possible. A client is always right but still he has to give respect towards the other person to whom he is talking. If someone will shout to a lady staff, asking her to make continuous repetitions (as a student) of everything that he was “saying”, of course for us that person is rude.  Finally the manager was not making any kind of interruptions while your were talking...It’s normal that he has to give a reply or explanation after each comment that you were pointing out otherwise we will not get any conclusion if he just remains in silence…...  Thank you for your attention and kind regards.  The Management

title: Vacations
review: Spent 3 nights here while in Florence.  It's about a 10 minute walk to the Duomo area which is very handy.  It's on a quiet street which is lovely for sleeping.   A nice courtyard area would be lovely for afternoon / evening drinks when the weather is a bit warmer.  Breakfast is plentiful and varied.  Service is attentive but not overbearing.  We would stay here again if every back in Florence.

title: Lovely hotel
review: Dear Jackie, We thank you very much for choosing the J and J Hotel and furthermore for sharing your experience with us. We are very happy to know that you loved the hotel very much. A big thank you from the entire staff as well and of course we will forward for your next stay.  Warmest regards The Management

title: original cozy place close to the attractions
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Wonderful hospitality
review: we stayed 3 days at J&J's. the hotel is very original given by its roots as a monastry, all rooms seem rather different full with old and new stuff. the location is perfect to discover the attractions like the duomo, santa croce and others, all is within a 10 minute walk. we had a very quite room which allowed a good sleep to fully recover after long days of discovering florence. the reception and the breakfast morning crew was very friendly they e.g. booked for us a restaurant that turned out to be very good, and not a simple tourist trap! there are some steep steps to be taken to reach some of the rooms, so for people with disabilities maybe not ideal. overall a very pleasant stay, so we can really recommend this place!

title: Excellent small hotel
review: Great location and wonderful hospitality from the entire staff.  The highlight is evening drinks in the charming lounge.  Each room is unique and tastefully decorated.   It's a short walk to the Duomo and there are plenty of great restaurants in the neighbourhood.

title: Home Away From Home
review: The hotel is an ideal base for exploring Florence, and good value. Situated on a quiet road it's an easy walk to the Duomo and other major attractions. Tastefully decorated, well-equipped and comfortable rooms. Welcoming and helpful staff.  I have stayed in Florence many times but this is my favourite hotel.

title: Very lovely place
review: Loved, loved, loved this cozy,chic hotel. It’s the perfect size, intimate. Staff will know you the second day. Service outstanding, everyone was focused on pleasing the customers. They also give you good recommendations for dinner within walking distance that are non-touristy. I will definitely stay again.

title: Great hotel, in great location
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Comfortable hotel in a very nice location
review: Booking online from hotel website was easy and very good value for the facilities they provide. The hotel is in a very good & quiet location, yet within very easy walking distance of all the major sights, as well as many excellent places to eat that are good value and mostly non-touristy. We had a very comfortable room on the first floor with plenty of space & good facilities.  The staff were all very friendly & helpful & ground floor spaces were attractive & comfortable. Breakfast was okay and we would have been happy to pay a bit extra, for more choices. We were able to buy bottled water very cheaply at a nearby local supermarket.

title: Great hotel, amazing room
review: Dear Edward,      Thank you very much for staying at the J and J Hotel and for taking your time sharing your experience with us. We are very happy to know that you loved the hotel a lot. A big thank you from the entire staff as well. Thank you for pointing out the breakfast which will be of course taken into consideration. We hope that this has not put you off for a next visit. Have a nice day and of course lots of joy/happiness for the forthcoming christmas and new year. Warmest regards The Management.

title: Large and cozy
review: We only stayed here for 1 night, but would have liked to stay a bit longer. Very friendly and helpful staff. The hotel is located very near the heart of the city centre. The rooms were very nice and the bed was comfortable.

title: Nice location and ambiance
review: Dear Fab, Thank you very much for staying with us and of course we look forward for your next stay. A great thank you as well from the staff.   Warmest regards The Management

title: Perfect
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: a Hidden Gem just a few blocks from the Duomo
review: Perfect location, huge beautiful room for a reasonable rate, super-friendly staff, lovely lobby, lounge area and courtyard. Great breakfast. Lots of ambience throughout. I would definitely stay there again.

title: Gorgeous hotel
review: Dear Mr Mooney,   Thank you very much for choosing our hotel for your stay in Florence and as well as for sharing your beautiful experience with us. We are very happy to know that you loved the hotel a lot and of course we look forward for your next visit. A big thank you as well from the entire staff. This is a very big encouragement for them. Have a nice day and of course a happy new year  Warmest regards The Management

title: I love J&J
review: We stayed 3 nights in this hotel that’s close to the key sights but just far enough away to be relaxing and quiet. The staff was friendly, engaging and informative. I’d recommend this hotel to my friends.

title: Novelty for first time visitors to Tuscany
review: Dear Mr Marlow,   Thank you very much for staying at the J and J Hotel and for taking your time sharing your beautiful experience with us. We are very happy to know that we were able to offer you a great service and that you loved the hotel a lot. We thank you in advance for your recommendations and we look forward to welcoming you next time.  Have a nice day and of course a happy new year  Warmest regards The Management

title: Lovely
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Absolutely charming
review: Wonderful.    Three females  and we could not have felt more welcome, safer, and in better hands.    To come "home" after a long day and have Patrick waiting with a glass of wine for us.  Nothing better.  Cannot wait to go back.   Rooms were just lovely,  location was perfect for walking,  and after the crowds so nice to have a quiet space in the beautiful little courtyard.  Thank you. Joanne Pagano

title: Patricia
review: Dear Mrs Pagano,   We thank you very much for choosing the J and J Hotel and for taking your time sharing your beautiful experience with us. Thank you very much for your fantastic feedback. We always try to offer the best service possible and when our guest remain happy and satisfied about everything, for us it is a huge encouragement to carry on what we have done so far. A big thank you as well from the entire staff, especially from Mr Patrick and of course we will look forward for your next visit. Have a nice day and best wishes for the forthcoming christmas and happy New year.  Warmest regards The Management

title: Charming hotel with super friendly staff
review: This hotel was first a convent built in the 16th century, but there is nothing austere about it. It is beautifully decorated and the staff is extremely friendly. If you go, eat at Natalino’s nearby. You won’t be disappointed.

title: Wonderful hotel
review: Dear Angelrich,                  Thank you very much for choosing our hotel and for sharing your experience with us. We are very happy to know that we have offered you a good sevice and you appreciated the hotel a lot. Thank you also for the reccomendation about the restaurant and we look forward for your next stay with us. Warmest regards The Management

review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Great Old Charm
review: Gorgeous gem of a hotel away from "tourist scene".  Used to be a convent and has a labrinth of rooms and suites.  Definately not wheelchair friendly...no lift.  Welcome drink on arrival.  Beautiful breakfasts.  Friendly and helpful staff.  Beautiful courtyard area and the bar tenders make amazing cocktails.  Would love tp come back again.

title: Great location but poor attention to detail.
review: Dear Mrs Birgit,           Thank you very much for taking your time to share the beautiful experience that you had at the J and J Hotel!! We are very happy to know that we wereable to deliver a good service and that you appreciated the hotel a lot. A big thank you as well from the entire staff and of course we look forward for your next stay with us.  Warmest regards The Management

title: Både og ...
review: The charm of this former abbey-turned-hotel is terrific. Just a short walk to some good restaurants. Our ground floor room was very large and clean, with a comfortable bed. Employees were quite friendly. We ordered wine from the bar and drank it in the lovely courtyard. The breakfast was just okay - it could have been better. A lovely place overall.

title: boutique-hotel with shabby-chic-charm in good location
review: Dear Sir/Madam,           Thank you very much for choosing our hotel and we are very happy to know that you loved it a lot. The whole staff would like to thank you for this beautiful feedback. Thank you for your remark regarding the breakfast which is very helpful for us and of course will be taken into consideration.We look forward to welcoming you next time.  Warmest regards The Management.

title: Rooms need Interior decorator advice
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Nice hotel, perfect location
review: Lovely  small hotel , but sleeping rooms need some interior decorating advice . There are minimalist looks , but these rooms seriously need a bit of  style ,to make visitors feel comfortable . Never stayed in such a plain room before , Rest t of the property had a lovely homely feel , but not the room .

title: Stay at J&J Historic House
review: Dear Valued Customer,           We thank you very much for staying at the J and J Hotel and for taking your time to share your experience with us. Every comments that will help us to improve are the most welcome and of course will be notified to the management. We hope that this has not put you off for a next stay with us.  Warmest regards Customer care.

title: Not true
review: This hotel has an excellent location, a few minute walk from the Duomo !  The garden, full of white flowers, is fantastic. Very pleasant staff, helpful and polite.  Large Deluxe room (some shortcomings described below).

title: Top !
review: Dear Valued Customer,              We thank you very much for your beautiful comment which has been very much appreciated. A big thank you from all the staff and we look forward for your next visit.  Warmest regards Customer care

title: Not what it used to be.
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Honey moon stay
review: Was one of the great hotels of Florence. Staff are very kind but no management at all. Booked transfer didn’t arrive. Was woken up every morning by staff talking with loud voices. An hour for tea to arrive from room service.,bacon ran out at breakfast at .9.15 an and they refused to cook more. Mini bar restocked once on five nights. Ordered water for the room and it took 2 days to be delivered after three requests. Staff smoking in front of guests in internal courtyard. Worst managed hotel I’ve stayed in ever. So sad because it’s beautiful and was great but clearly the family that own it are trying to cut costs. Sheets not changed in five nights. Disgraceful fir the level they charge at.,

title: My stay at J & J for 3rd time
review: Dear Sir, We thank you very much for booking the J and J Hotel and for taking your time to share your stay with us. We sincerely apologize if you think that you had a bad experience with us. About the transfer, as already explained to you upon check in, the driver arrived for the pick up but unfortunately a bit late because several flights were delayed that day. Therefore due to this unforseen inconvenience he was not able to guaranty the service on time as originally scheduled.By the time when he was coming to meet you, you chose to take a taxi. We are really very sorry for that. Concerning the bacon, it can happen that it finishes before when the hotel is full and during rush hours but we will never refuse to prepare more. We can't do that as we have to guaranty the service till the end. May be you forgot but after 5/8 minutes fresh eggs & bacon were served to you and to other guests waiting. We apologize if you had to wait those 5/8 minutes. Room service is done everyday so bed sheets changing, cleaning are guaranteed by our staff. Minibars are checked and refilled regularly too. The hotel is managed directly by the owner so no point of cutting costs!! She always run it as her own house so that clients can feel at home and hence the staff will always offer their best to make the guests happy and comfortable.  We wish you all the best and hope to see you soon at our hotel. Warmest regards The Management

title: A lovely stay
review: The place is very cozy, boutique, and the service is great. Very willing to help and answer any questions. We booked a regular room and when we arrived we got the suite because of our honeymoon. I recommend of the place

title: Out of season weekend stay
review: Dear Sir/Madam,  Thank you very much for staying at the J and J Hotel and it's a pleasure to know that you had a good experience with us. We look forward to welcoming you in the future.  Warmest regards The Management

title: It is definitely not  a 4 stars hotel
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Central location within 5-10 mins walk of all the main sites
review: We toke a suite, the Room was large but it is forbidden to eat inside in the room for “hygienic purposes”, just for using room service you are charged 10 euros regardless of service excluding the price of the service itself, beware the bathroom has stairs - very slippery , the cleaner entered the room without knocking while we were getting dressed regardless of us yelling don’t open the door and finally the buffet is till 10:30 however they don’t refill and you are expected to be there at 7:30. we went at 9:00am and there was no plates or cutlery on the tables, they assumed we don’t want breakfast. the decor of the room was authentic and beautiful and they have a small beautiful garden.

title: Absolutely wonderful!!!
review: Dear Sir/Madam,               First of all we thank you very much for choosing our hotel and for taking your time to share about your recent stay.We are very disappointed to read about your experience and we are sincerely very sorry about the inconveniences caused. We are aware that only apologizing will not alter the outcome of your experience but certainly we will address with the concerned party about the points you have mentioned and mainly about the poor service that you have received during breakfast.  Thank you very much for your nice comments about the room and the patio.  Again we beg your pardon and we hope that these events have not put you off a return stay with us again.  Kind regards The Management

title: Wonderful Florence hotel experience
review: The best description would be slightly shabby chic although having said that overall we enjoyed our stay.    Could do with a lick of paint internally and the bathroom could have done with a few improvements such as fixing the radiator and having a bit more shelf space around the basin rather than under it.    Breakfast was acceptable although I thought they could have stretched to some fesh orange juice rather than the cheap sweet stuff offered.   Bacon and scrambled eggs only every day but good selections of breads, fruit etc.    The one daily irritation the fact that the heating in our room was timed not to come on before 6pm...after hard days siteseeing we wanted to have a rest to re-charge our batteries at around 4.30pm but the room was cold.   After pointing out to…

title: Amazing Convent from the 16th century
review: Dear Sir/Madam,         Thank you very much for sharing your stay experience with us. We sincerely apologize for all the inconveniences and of course pointing out these problems will help us to improve a lot for the future. We hope that you will continue to be our return guest in the future.  Kind regards The Management

title: Excellent location,
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Advertisement no elevator many stairs!
review: This is a lovely hotel, with very friendly, helpful staff. The courtyard was beautiful and the 'happy hour' provided an opportunity to have a proseco or coffee after a full day of exploring Florence and surrounds. Breakfast was fresh and plentiful and could be taken outside in the pretty courtyard as well. Our twin room was very spacious, clean and very comfortable.  However, we could hear everything from the room above... EVERYTHING - not just footsteps and conversation!!!! If you want a quiet, undisturbed stay, don't stay in room 11! The only other point to note is there is no elevator. If you have mobility difficulties ask for a ground floor room.

title: Gem of a hotel in centre of Florence
review: Dear Helen,         thank you very much for staying at the Hotel J and J as well as for taking your time sharing your travel experience with us. We are very happy to hear that you liked quite everything about the hotel hence we wanted to express our apòlogies regarding the noises coming from the room upstairs..We are aware that we have this problem in some rooms as the building itself was a 16th century convent. We expect to resolve this issue in the future and we hope this hasn't put you off for a return stay with us again.  Warm regards The  Management.

title: Unique and beautiful retreat
review: We made reservations for the J&J Historic House hotel referral from couple that stayed 5 years ago.  Old building quaint, outside garden very nice.  When we arrived our room was not ready.  They held our luggage since we had tickets to museums.  Later that evening went to check in, we had three flight of stairs to the room.  The other couple had two flights of stairs.  Both rooms the bathroom was on first floor, bedroom had winding concrete stairs on 2nd floor.  The advertisement does not mention no elevator nor bathroom not on same floor as bedroom.  We had two rooms reserved for two couples, one person had hip surgery problem with stairs the other knee problems  Requested two other rooms, they only had one available that was four flights up to the room but did have bathroom on…

title: First time in Italy
review: Dear Sir/Madam,            Thank you very much for booking our hotel and we are very disappointed to read about your experience upon your arrival. We apologize sincerely for all the inconveniences caused and we are sorry that you didn't get a detailed description about the hotel from your travel agency. While all our partners always have a full information of how the building looks like, unfortunately it happens that sometimes they forget to pass these information to the guests. Our bad luck that day that we were unable to switch you to another room due to unavailabilty and hence we regret that you decided to check out. The hotel being a historical building of the16th century can't be granted a permit from the council to install a lift inside. We had this project years ago but then it remained like this.  We agree that upon check out there was a misunderstanding with the concierge about your cancellation policy and you were overcharged by mistake. Afterwards the extra amount charged was correctly refunded back on your credit card.  Again we apologize for everything. Warm regards The Management

title: Wonderful authentic Italian experience
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: A lovely spot with beautiful character - close to the sites in Florence!
review: We spent 1 night at the hotel in room 2. Very large bedroom and bath. The room is located right on the indoor garden area which can be good or bad if people are sitting and talking right outside your room. We did not have a problem with it. The hotel was full but very quiet. We had a late train to Rome the next day but were able to spend the day in the hotel all day off and on as needed. They allowed us to use the restroom and even have a cigar and cocktail in the enclosed patio area. The location is great and front desk staff very helpful.

title: Beautiful, Relaxing Stay
review: Dear Sir/Madam,     A great thank you to you about your beautiful comment. We are happy that the hotel and staff met your expectations and made you feel comfortable and satisfied. See you soon!! Kind regards  The Management

title: Fantastic Hotel
review: This hotel is lovely...with calm and serene 'feel-good' sitting areas and patio.  It's location is ideal - close to walk to all the sites.  It is bright and has a very welcoming lobby, with friendly staff.  Beautiful historic building - which lends character to the rooms.  We stayed in Room 2 - and although we did not get to see the other rooms, I'm not sure it would be my first pick...it is close to where the patio is, as well as where breakfast is served, so there is some noise in the room in the mornings.  The room, however, was large and comfortable (for Italy standards!) so we did enjoy that when we walked in.  Delicious breakfast - and made to order cappuccinos made it an ideal place to sit and read a book and unwind.  Even the bar 'officially' closes at 9, the staff were…

title: Somewhat disappointing
review: Dear Guest, its is great to hear that you had a memorable stay with us and thank you for praising our service. We invest a lot of time in effort to train our team to ensure the highest level of personalized service. All the best and hope to see you soon! warm regards The Management

title: Quaint and quirky
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Peace and serenity !
review: Four stars - I'm not totally sure but 3 would be too few.  The breakfast room, sitting room and outside courtyard are quaint and original.  We never got to sit in the courtyard as it was full of smokers - come on hotel get in the real world.  Our room was a mezzanine affair with bedroom upstairs and bathroom downstairs and very old steep creaky stairs to get up and down.  If you don't like mozzies and spiders dropping from the rafters this is not for you.  Bed comfy but décor and walls tired and in need of decoration.  The bedroom window looks directly into other peoples houses - so you are steeped in Italian living.  the air conditioning was not working and it took them 2 days to fix it. Right bang next to the centre so position is 10/10. Breakfast very good.

title: Disappointing
review: This hotel is perfect ! Just perfectly located, peaceful and so cosy! We loved the moment we spent! Breakfast was great and very easy to reach by car Also. The patio is a huge place to rest and have breakfast !

title: Fantastic hotel convenient location
review: I was looking for this stay at the J&J as comments read on social media were positive and pictures looked promising. However I was really disappointed, for the following reasons: - really poor a/c in the room and none in the bathroom - quite a nuisance when temperatures exceed 40C outside) - poor wifi - limited choice at the breakfast buffet  - really dirty cushions on the chairs of the breakfast room - poorly equipped bathroom with cheap tiny products - poorly executed shower: no support whatsoever to place your soap, you need to put it on the floor; only a shower head, impossible to shower without wetting your hair  The worse? When the cleaning person forgot her large trash bag in the middle of the room. Pleasant surprise when you arrive...  All in all, not the quality…

title: Unique hotel
review: This hotel was perfect. We had a twin room with terrace and fantastic bathroom. There was a mini fridge in the room which we stocked with our own drinks.  There was a hairdryer in the bathroom. Breakfast was very nice - scrambled eggs and bacon, croissants fruit and lots more. Staff were very polite and couldn't do enough to help. The hotel is ideally placed for site seeing, just 10 minutes from duomo. I have no negative comments about this hotel - it was perfect.

title: Beautiful
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Quixotic
review: Beautiful hotel downtown... they as well offer parking if you have rented a car... the interiors are well kept and very well decorated both in common areas and rooms... very good service ... thanks we will back

title: Beautiful and friendly
review: Lovely find in a sweet little neighborhood. Beds are great. Pillows not so much. Staff was extremely helpful but be prepared to climb stairs.  Breakfast is acceptable but local cafes are plentiful.  Don't go expecting the Ritz and you will not be disappointed.

title: J&J Visit
review: My favourite hotel in Florence. All the rooms are beautifully decorated and are all different. The staff is super friendly and helpful. Nice and quiet location in easy reach of all the sights .Looking forward to coming back soon

title: Family wedding
review: Just left this lovely hotel. My wife and I have been to Florence 4 times before this visit but never stayed here. When we were meandering around Florence on foot our last trip in we came across the J&J and stepped in to look. We both decided this was where we were staying our next trip in and I'm glad we stayed. We had a top floor suite with balcony which was very spacious and clean. The a/c worked well.  Daily housekeeping was perfect. Breakfast was included and more than generous. Front desk staff friendly and always there to help.

title: Lovely hotel
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: J & J
review: We recently spent 5 nights at the J&J and it suited us well as we much prefer to stay in a quiet, peaceful  hotel. The beds were very comfortable, the linen and towels changed regularly, the bathroom was splended. We were in Florence in 30c degrees but the aircon cooled our room comfortably though it wasn't always necessary to have it on as the thick walls and high ceilings of the building kept the temperature down anyway.We loved the layout of the hotel which gave the rooms a private and secluded feel, there's also a little private outside area accessed from our ground floor room but the man eating mosquitoes made being outside a bit risky it still gave an airy feel to the room. Noise from other quests was at a minimum due to the way the rooms are situated.After walking around…

title: Weekend break
review: Old world charm, set in the cobble stoned streets of Florence. The thought of once a monastery ,  gives it a nosatalgic feel .The rooms are set away from each other down long hallways or up staircases. Very private. Very close to the Duome, shopping and quaint shops.

title: Interesting building, lovely helpful staff, a few niggles..
review: The hotel is a converted convent and suitably quirky, for instance our bathroom was down a small fight of stairs. We loved it where as some reviewers hated it. If you like a friendly clean hotel with good staff and are not concerned about facilities such as gyms etc I would recommend it. Breakfast is a basic but pleasant continental style served in a lovely room with vaulted ceilings with an option to eat outside in a courtyard.  The hotel is a short walk from the main sights and in an area with some very nice restaurants. The street it is on is narrow but seemed safe, once you got used to cyclists and the electric taxis creeping up on you!

title: Horrible Experience
review: Interesting converted convent building, perhaps best described as 'shabby chic' but we felt was in line with its boutique type description. We liked the slight quirky decor, overall happy with the room, big comfortable bed, lovely linens that were changed regularly throughout our stay. Nice walk in style rustic shower room, surprisingly with English toiletries! Mini bar prices were really good, we were pleasantly surprised.  Best feature was the staff; all we met spoke excellent English, and turned out to be a valuable resource, they were able to book us priority tickets for the major attractions. Fantastic. Which brings me neatly to a few downpoints.  Lack of hotel information in the rooms. There was a folder and a few brochures for local attractions, but not the comprehensive…

title: Tourism in Florence during Easter 2017
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Hotel close to Duomo
review: Good hotel, well situated near the historical center of Florence. Room 14. Quite large with a private terrace. Comfortable bed. Very spacious bathroom with all the commodities. Breakfast and cocktail (in the evening) complete and good. Negative points : the room lacks of lights and plugs (to reload the smartphones for example). Not so pleasant to shave oneself in the bathroom... Furthermore, there were ants in the room (Watch the biscuits or food you buy if you don't want bad surprises)... At last, some problem of insonorisation, but we had the chance to have neighbours that slept quite soon at night.

title: Just OK Hotel not 4 *
review: The room was nice and the overall look of the hotel was vey nice. Good breakfast with good coffee. On the other hand I didn't have the best experience at the hotel. There was construction workers 2 meters away from my window working on the roof which started at 7:50am (which the hotel did not warn me about this). It was very unpleasant. They claimed they didn't know but i know by law that they would have. Secondly my room was not cleaned the second day i was there. Apparently when you leave the hotel you must leave your key at reception. Which they did not specify to me. I wouldn't stay again because of this experience but I'm sure others have had a difference.

title: Fabulous stay in florence - ideal location and hotel
review: Stayed here for 3 nights, staff really nice and helpful. Area safe and close to shops, bars & restaurants.  We stayed in Junior Suite Split Level, bed comfy with good quality linen. A real pain having to go down stairs to use loo in the middle of the night but that's not a big deal. Room is dull and sofa uncomfortable. Nice bathroom with great rain shower but the toilet is the most uncomfortable loo we have ever come across - it is half the width of a normal one and about 4 inches higher so you legs dangle and unless you have a very pert bottom, most of it will sit outside the toilet. We found the most comfortable way to use it was to sit facing the cistern as opposed to back to the cistern - it really was that bad ! I'm sure there are much nicer places in the Beautiful City of…

title: Pleasant stay
review: We were thrilled with this small boutique hotel - converted Convent, with all the original features just beautiful.  The location was superb,just far enough from Duomo but easy to walk in every day. The rooms are lovely and all very different. We went for some amazing meals that the reception recommended each night, some local to the hotel some on the walk into the City - all fabulous.  the first night we went to the restaurant 3-4 doors up and the beef speciality was amazing.  Napolitano in a square towards city was great as was Gionva (there are two in the same street) i would advise always booking ahead as they were always busy. We booked the Tour cycle round Florence which was fab, and cycled up the hill to the Palace, was beautiful and we preferred to the walking tours.…

title: Charming Hotel
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Charming Hotel
review: A nice Historic Hotel located near all what you want to see in Florence. The Room was clean and the Personal friendly. The Bathroom we think needs a renovation. Breakfast and Service was as we wanted it.

title: Lovely boutique hotel in centre
review: A former convent retaining many original features.  Set in a quiet location just five minutes walk from the Duomo.  We were upgraded to a suite which was very spacious.  Comfy bed, good quality linens and excellent staff.  Breakfast was plentiful with cold meats, cheese, fruit, yogurt, fresh bread and scrambled eggs. Would recommend the hotel.

title: Disappointing
review: Very charming little hotel in the centre, 10 min walk to main square and ponte vecchio. Staff was friendly and room spacious, with overlooking mezzanine. Room was also a depandance in the internal courtyard. Very pretty! Definitely worth staying again.

title: Updated Convent
review: Room (19...) was nothing short of fantastic but the smell of cigarette was everywhere, which was disappointing, especially since I always ask for a non smoking room.  Even though I asked if it would be possible to take care or reduce the problem, nothing was really done unfortunately. On the good side, the breakfast and the restaurant space were great and I couldn't have been more satisfied with the food and the atmosphere. The location in the center of Florence was also one of the high notes. Finally all the people (almost) at the hotel were extremely pleasant but I have to mention one instance that bothered me: I went back to the hotel at 1am with my daughter and one of her friend who needed a taxi; my daughter went inside to ask the night person who refused to call and…

title: Perfect place to stay in old town Firenze
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: What a find....
review: Wonderful location, very helpful staff, delicious breakfast.  Fun to have a bar on sight.  Only downside was the stairs though the bell person was always ready to accommodate us. Laura at reception was especially helpful, printing our boarding passes, suggesting restaurants, arranging tours,

title: awesome boutique hotel
review: Besides being a wonderful hotel it is the staff that makes a difference ... everyone from the front desk to the bus boys could not do enough to make our stay outstanding.  This is a converted convent, but you would never know it.  Clean and modern, with a wonderful morning buffet.  Well located.

title: Lovely old hotel
review: Awsome hotel, went to florence for a couple of days, close to everything...amazing room, good service, delicious breakfast, can't complain about anything, the staff seems to really care about the customers....

title: Positive experience at J&J Hotel September 2016
review: I loved this hotel.  The location was central.  Very walkable to sites and restaurants..  We had a room in what must have been an old coach house.  The room had two floors joined by an old stone, winding staircase.  The hotel had a lovely terrace which was located outside our room.    I loved the place!

title: What a gem
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: great trip
review: My partner and I stayed here on our trip to Florence and we couldn't say a bad thing about this place. The location is unbeatable,it's so close to the Duomo and they even provide bicycles to explore the city, aside from the cobble stones it is the best way to get about!  The staff were friendly and always happy to help and our room was so unique and beautiful.  The hotel has so much character! This hotel is a must when visiting Florence. Highly recommend!

title: Small hotel on walking distance of the highlights of Florence
review: This was my favorite hotel we stayed at! It was in the perfect location for walking everywhere! Our room was so nice and big! We had 2 bathrooms, plenty of space and the air conditioning was so cold! Loved our room at the top of the stairs! One of the coolest hotels ever! Would definitely stay there again!

title: Charming and intimate stay in this special boutique Hotel
review: Nice and good location and pretty room but no personal touch in service.  Would be nice if the reception of the hotel welcomes you !  The hotel has all the possibilities to upgrade the atmosphere! More eye for detail is necessary !

title: Nice luxury stay
review: Service was excellent in this convivial place. Very quiet time a night and very comfortable bed to recover from a long day working in Firenze.  This historic hotel has a lot of cache.  I recommend highly your stay there!

title: Disaster. Booked 4 nights but checked out next day.
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Great spot, glorious rooms, fabulous stay
review: Visited the hotel on August 9th, 2016. This is a maximum 1 star hotel although it is advertised as a 4 star hotel. They justify the poor condition of the hotel and furniture saying that it is "old and historic". So is the rest of Florence and Europe so don't fall for that.  The staff is very willing and tries hard to please but it very transparent that they are not professionals. They are willing but not very capable. At breakfast they came in their street clothes and delivered the pastries to the breakfast area that they purchased from some supplier. They run around like the hotel is a gym. Also at breakfast they start doing the dishes at the bar - manual washing, no dishwasher - that is right in the breakfast area, so you have your breakfast in the rumble noises of dish…

title: Could be nice
review: Our room was a Quad suite accommodating 2 kids and 2 adults.   It was perfect, and huge! The hotel was close to everything, the staff were overly accommodating and we couldn't have asked for a better place to stay.  We stayed for 2 nights. Loved the layout and the design.

title: Worst hotel I've ever stayed in
review: This could be a wonderful hotel if.. Breakfast was calm and serene, personnel was very noisy, I wonder if they need to change plates , glasses and cutlery every month. The room was great, but it was damp and had a strong cellar smell.

title: Quaint, elegant, quiet
review: Arrived late at night. No sleep all night due to the A/C in the room which sounded like a diesel train and could not be turned off. The room wasn't very clean, there was dust on top of mirrors, furniture, etc, and no wardrobe or anywhere else to hang clothes. The beds were small (anyone over 5 feet tall would have trouble), had no headboards, and oldish, itchy blankets. The mini-bar was a cool box. The following morning we were a few minutes late for breakfast but could not even get coffee, unless we paid extra.  Staff could not fix the A/C. Even when it was turned off it continued to operate. We covered it with pillows and blankets in an attempt to drown out the noise over the whole four days. Opening the small window wasn't an option either as the area right outside (we were…

title: Beautiful and elegant hotel in the center of Florence
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Charming hotel full of character
review: We felt really happy about this little gem that we found on Internet. The hotel is classic, elegant, cosy... everything was perfect for our honeymoon. The personal was really nice and profesional. We will go back soon.

title: Wonderful Boutique Hotel!
review: Fantastic quiet location just a short walk from the city centre. Our room was large and overlooked the courtyard. Breakfast was nice and the staff were very friendly and helpful.There were a few steps to our room which was not a problem for us at all.

title: Charming and cosy hotel
review: J and J was a wonderful hotel in Florence.  The location is great - it's a walk to many of the sights in Florence.  The breakfast is in a beautiful room and courtyard.  The service was wonderful and the room was very nice.  There are only 23 rooms each one is different.  Ours had a circular stairway to a small second floor balcony.  It was room 1 and it was right off of the courtyard.  I would definitely recommend J and J!

title: Quaint hotel in Florence
review: The J&J is a charming and cosy hotel which was founded as a 16th century monastery and you can still imagine the scenery as a lot is decoratively preserved. The staff is not only friendly, but focussed on customers and not only wants you to have a unique and pleasant experience, they actually pratice what they preach.

title: Good hotel in good location
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Beautiful hotel - fabulous location!
review: Stayed for 2 nights  Good hotel in good location close to everything  Rooms were a good size and nice and clean  Breakfast was nice but staff always made you feel uncomfortable as they were always running around trying to reset tables and make coffee clearly they need more staff to take the pressure off  The only let down was the reception staff  they never went out of there way to make you feel welcome ,it always felt you were putting them out . They couldn't even be bothered to say goodbye or even ask if we enjoyed our stay  The staff can make all the difference to a great and memorable stay  Such a shame as its a really nice hotel

title: Great B&B
review: We loved our stay at the J and J.  The staff was very helpful, the rooms were beautiful and huge!  They have a lovely courtyard where we enjoyed breakfast and cocktails in the evening.  Breakfast was included in our room but was very disappointing.    This location was perfect.  An easy walk to all attractions and lots of great restaurants.

title: Nice interior but that's it
review: Dear Sir/Madam,                     Thank you very much for staying with us and we look forward to welcoming you next time.  Kind regards

title: Great place to stay in a good location with friendly staff
review: Loved the J & J! Beautiful rooms, clean, fantastic continental breakfast and friendly & helpful staff. Great location. WOuld have loved to spend a few more days in FLorence. We would definitely stay here again!

title: Just as wonderful 20 years later
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: J & J Historic House
review: 20 years ago a friend in the travel industry recommended this hotel.  My husband and I were completely charmed and returned this summer with our teenage daughters.  We were not disappointed.  The staff is warm, welcoming and helpful.  The location is very convenient and our room- though different- was unique and put us fully into the ambience of Florence.

title: ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL, LUXURIOUS HOTEL BUT........
review: J & J Historic House is a nice location in a quiet area, walking distance to Duomo, museums and most sites. Breakfast is very nice option rolls, meats, cheese fresh juices, including one hot item such as eggs, in an airly shared space. First room was on the first floor quiet and cool but had noisy upstairs guests, asked to move but could not accommodate until the 3rd night of 4 night stay.  Moved to the second room # 7 upstairs, very warm and you have to open windows for cooling air, but had no screens on windows, and we gotten eaten by mosquitoes. Window covering let in lots of lights.  Both rooms had nice big bathrooms.  Staff was lovely. Recommend screens or turn on the A/C.

title: Perfect stay in every way
review: I sincerely wish I could give this Hotel an EXCELLENT rating !!! The hotel was beautiful and very clean and the bed was soooo comfortable !!! The breakfast buffet was delicious however they NEED to keep their scrambled eggs warm-- 3 of the 4 days we spent here the eggs were room temperature to COLD  ( Not a good thing !!). My complaint with this beautiful hotel was the front desk staff--- they could really use a more friendly, customer oriented staff.... I really hate saying this as the staff brought down this hotel . The biggest complaint I have is that the hotel would not accept a large banknote we wanted to use to pay our hotel bill--- we gave them 2 -  500 Euro Bank notes to pay for our 845 Euro bill and the girl at the front desk said she didn't have the change ( 155Euro) …

title: everything we wished for
review: The J & J Hotel is perfectly positioned for visiting the central attractions in Florence - Il Duomo, Ponte Vecchio, Palazzo Pitti - they are all within 10 - 15 mins walk through the beautiful streets of this fabulous city. The staff can't do enough for you and the rooms are magnificent, each having it's own quirky lay out but not taking anything away from the wonderful architecture and original features of this old converted convent. You will find a lovely cool and tranquil courtyard in the centre of the building where you can sit and relax with a cold glass of vino whilst taking in the atmosphere which is steeped in history. I would totally recommend this hotel, and even if it is in quite a central position it is very calm and quite. My thanks to all the staff for making our…

title: The Best Hotel in Florence
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Great small neighborhood hotel
review: The J & J Hotel is managed by charming, friendly, accommodating staff and is decorated with the upmost style and rustic elegance. A courtyard and luscious green garden with hydrangeas in decadent pots waits for you after a walk or bike ride around the best parts of the city. The hotel will lend you bikes with a basket on the front to carry your bag and any shopping you pick up along the way. Incredibly interior decorated suites that make you feel like a movie star in an old Italian film - quiet; away from main roads yet a central location perfect for sightseeing and strolling in the stunning, ancient stone streets of Florence. Take a wonderful breakfast of fresh juices, coffee, teas, cereals and hot foods in the beautiful dining room or in the courtyard with the sound of Italian…

title: Romantic olde worlde hotel
review: We enjoyed our stay at the J&J.  I loved the shabby chic décor, and the staff was very nice.  The breakfast provided lots of choices.  There were many good restaurants within a short walk, and it was close to the leather shops and to the Duomo and other attractions.  The price was very reasonable for a nice hotel.

title: Amazing Oasis
review: Florence was midway in our 3 week Italian holiday and we arrived for just the one night (cos i couldn't extend our Airbnb booking in Florence for an additional night) right on my husband's birthday.  Like most renovated old Italian buildings, the room you get will be very individual.  Reception area was like being in a stylish Italian house living room with vaulted ceilings. Helpful bellman hauled our heavy baggage up one flight of stairs.  The bedroom had a four poster bed, very clean, one small window (sufficient - no view), and a quirky staircase leading down from our bedroom internally into a rather dark but stylish bathroom.  Very comfortable bed and next morning had good very relaxed breakfast in inner courtyard on beautiful day - very romantic and classically Italian…

title: J & J historical hotel
review: Warm and welcoming staff upon arrival.  The boutique hotel that is a historic monastery is absolutely beautiful!  There is a lovely courtyard and the spread for breakfast was delicious and well presented.  Location is perfect!

title: Quiet and central location
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: A good place to stay with reasonable price
review: Old and charming building, which also means that there is no lift and that the rooms are different in size and layout. Ours faced an inner courtyard (of the neighbouring house).The room itself was average, but the true gem of the hotel was the inner courtyard where You could unwind after a busy day with a drink, or even have Your breakfast. Great location with most sites within walking distance and plenty of restaurants nearby. Very friendly and versatile staff !

title: Very charming with character
review: Dear Sir/Madam,            Thank you very much.  Kind regards The Management

title: Beautiful hotel
review: This hôtel is very well located in a quiet street less than 1km from main touristiques places. The rooms are ok and thé service issus friendly.  The hôtel does  not have restaurant or room service. Therefore à good place to stay for an ok price

title: Beautiful Hotel in a great location
review: Very charming with a lot of character in very quite area but at only 5 minutes walking distance of every most important site. Very comfortable room but in my point of view some issues with isolation. A perfect breakfast with a lot of choices.

title: A Perfectly Lovely and Quiet Place ~
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Perfect location
review: When planning a trip to Florence, my daughter suggested the J&J as it is in close proximity to her apartment.  The location was perfect and we enjoyed the boutique hotel - a former convent, situated on a very quiet, but safe, side street.  We especially enjoyed the breakfast - served in a nicely decorated and comfortable set of rooms (dining and patio) just off the lobby - and were pleased with our rooms. (we stayed on two different weekends)  We were able to easily walk to all the areas of Florence we were interested in - both sites and shopping. Also worth mentioning is the fact the J& J hosts many interesting travelers - most English speaking - from Europe and the US - and everyone was friendly.  The Staff - including everyone from the front desk personnel to the breakfast…

title: A little slice of peaceful Florence
