review: The location of this hotel is perfect, you have in principle everything within walking distance.  Common areas very nice, feels like a home with a patio.  Our room (number 15) was the only disappointment. We had booked a deluxe room and it was OK in size but quite dark and unfriendly.  Very good and service mixed staff.

title: Lovely hotel
review: My wife and I needed a place to stay for 1 night in Florence before heading back to the states.  The J and J was great!  Large comfortable bed, large clean modern bathroom. Being 6'5" tall and 280 lbs. I do not fit in most Italian bathrooms.  We loved the breakfast in the sitting area and courtyard. The staff was very attentive to anything my wife and I needed.  Florence is very hectic and busy.  The J and J was a beautiful and relaxing slice of Florence.

title: Well looked after
review: We stayed in the J and J for 4 nights. Excellent location within easy walking distance to all the major sights. We were in a deluxe room, number 11 on the ground floor which was huge. The hotel is in a converted convent and is so peaceful and quiet. All the staff were very accommodating and really helpful. Excellent breakfast selection. Would highly recommend. 5*s

title: A wonderful stay in Florence
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Smart but cosy boutique hotel
review: Excellent Location - friendly efficient service - outstanding breakfast - could have had a better location for exploring the wonderful city that is Florence Easy working distance to the heart of the city - in a quiet street with little traffic

title: Only ok.
review: This hotel is well located close to restaurants and main sites.  But quiet!  Staff are very friendly, the decor is charming ....... It is in a former 16th century convent.  Excellent breakfast and lovely courtyard. We would certainly stay there again.

title: Family holiday with my daughters
review: Located close to the heart of Firenze. A small but charming hotel. Unfortunately not a big fan of the stairs, very steep, relatively hard to reach our room on the 2nd floor with a baby. When we called to get room service at night around 8pm (for tea and milk) they said "you have to come and get it yourself because we have no staff to deliver it", so note to self get stuff you need before you go to your rooms. But mind you the staffs were very accommodating when they are around. The breakfast was ok could have been better -they could make changes to freshen things us every couple of days (we stayed there for 5 days). Our stay was ok, not enough to make us comeback. PS: don't bring car, the parking fees will choke you!

title: Charming, Historic and Convenient
review: Booked the hotel via Very Chic as I have used them frequently over the last 2 years an they have never seize to amaze me with their picks. However The J&J Hotel is extremely misleading. I booked the hotel for its charm an the pictures on the website are very far removed from the reality. The hotel is not 4 stars, I would put it into 2 stars. The beds are sinking in the middle, walls peeling, and there's absolutely nothing charming about this place sadly.   It would appear after speaking to the reception that the rooms advertised reflects 2 of their delux suites the balance of the rooms are below par. If you looking for a romantic get away stay far away from this hotel. Would I recommend it to anyone else? Definitely not and sadly a huge disappointment

title: Nice hotel in Florence
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Incredible boutique hotel in florence
review: The hotel was nice, close to all of the major sites in Florence.  The staff is really helpful.  The breakfast had a lot of variety and was quite good.  The room was comfortable and there was a nice selection of pillows

title: Charming and tasteful
review: Our friends recommended this place for us and we can see why! We had booked a junior suite but for upgraded to the most beautiful suite I've ever stayed in. The hotel is authentic and exactly what I'd hoped for style wise, it's so elegant. The staff are great, breakfast is lovely and the location is perfect for walking everywhere. We cannot wait to come back!!!

title: Uncomfortable room, no elevator, poor service
review: This small charming hotel in a 16th century house is very tastefully furnished and extremely comfortable. No elevators but the beautiful authentic stone stairway will take you into another century. You'll feel you own a home in Florence. Want the real Italian food experience? We highly recommend the restaurant Acquacotta round the corner.

title: J and J was Molto Bene!!
review: We were surprised by how poor our stay was at Hotel J and J. There is no elevator, and the stairs up to our room were narrow and steep. The room itself was poorly lit, could barely connect to wifi, and uncomfortable. The bathroom, although it was nicely designed, was down a small flight of stairs from the bedroom, making things even more uncomfortable. The service was not good. There were loud noises right outside our room in the middle of the night. We called reception 3 times to see what it was, and nobody answered. Would not recommend.

title: Wonderful stay
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: One not to miss
review: We stayed for three nights and were very comfortable.  This is a small and unique hotel in a 16th century house an easy walking distance to the centre and sites of Florence. The hotel staff are friendly, welcoming and very helpful in regard to recommending restaurants etc.  A really good buffet breakfast is available each morning. You are alsooffered a welcome drink on arrival.

title: Nice bedrooms and breakfast space
review: It is hard for me to share how wonderful this hotel is. The employees were so friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet is incredible.  I will stay here in a heartbeat next time I am in Florence. The location is one of the best. The rooms are all different and I did have one room that had a very long staircase but I found that room one of my favorites. Please advise at booking if you have a problem with many steps. I sure did - 5 stars! PS - I am a travel agent so I have been to a few places to compare  Enjoy!

title: The definitive boutique hotel
review: If you enjoy European style elegance, thick walls, and character, you'll like this hotel. If, however, you're looking for huge rooms with modern furniture, this is not for you. We very much enjoyed our deluxe room, spread over 2 floors; felt like a small Florence apartment. The breakfast area is lovely and well curated, offering an assortment of italian style as well as continental breakfast items. Very good deal for Florence, where it's so easy to be disappointed.

title: Unique and wonderful.
review: We enjoyed 5 nights at the J&J staying in one of the top floor suites.  A very large room and plenty of space.  The staff were courteous and helpful.  The breakfast room was a delight as was the lounge.  The breakfast fare catered for a wide variety from an uncluttered buffet table.    Getting around was easy with good local dining choices and an easy stroll to the main attractions.   We'd definitely return!

title: Sweet hotel
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Friendly staff and convenient location
review: The rooms were really sweet, and the breakfast good, although the hotel is located down not the best back alley. We stayed in one of the suites which was absolutely huge and had our own nice balcony where we could look out over the rooftops of florence.

title: Great November Weekend
review: Hotel has a friendly staff. Located just 10 mins walk from the Duomo. All the main attractions are nearby only. Breakfast was nice.  Room was not that big and a small bed too .   I would recommend this hotel as it's location is very convenient.

title: Great hotel!
review: Perfect location, less than 10 minutes away from the Cathedral. With safe parking across the street. Beautiful room in an wonderful old house/palazzo. Great service, great pricing, great breakfast. So close to the center of town, and yet so quiet and intimate! Don't forget to go to the market at Saint Ambrogio before breakfast - just 5 Minutes away!

title: The Most Amazing People work here and the location is Perfect!
review: The hotel was in great location, the staff was very friendly & helpful, their recommendations for restaurants were great :)... plus they were so thoughtful to upgrade us to a suit room because of my husbands 35th birthday :). the hotel decoration was amazing, it has a character!

title: Florence visit
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Delightful hotel
review: My wife and I stayed at Hotel J&J. We found it a very pleasant and charming hotel, well appointed, conveniently situated on a side street near the centre of the city, with welcoming and helpful staff. A slight feeling of shabby chic which we liked.

title: Potential to be wonderful, but important details missing
review: We had a wonderful stay at this delightful hotel. Close to all the attractions but far enough away to feel we were in a peaceful area. Lovely spacious room which was only used as a base as most of the time we were exploring Florence. It was a unique hotel with helpful staff. Breakfast was great with plenty on offer.

title: Short Breaks
review: I was looking at hotels through Expedia and found J and J. The price seemed reasonable, but something happened and a page came up suggesting staying for less and I accidentally agreed to a non refundable reservation when I thought I had clicked on the refundable one.  I immediately called Expedia once I got the confirmation, which in turn tried to contact the hotel at that exact moment and several others over the the course of 3 days, to rectify the situation and revert the reservation to refundable, or just cancel it. However, for the first 2 days, nobody was available to take the call, or Expedia emails. On the third day, the manager responded, but was adamant in not changing it, no matter what we told him. He did upgrade us to a suite, without extra cost, mostly because there…

title: Exclusive with a twist...
review: The staff has provided a very good and friendly service. We stayed in the junior suite and the room was spacious. The hotel is situated in a quiet street and is about 10 minutes walk to the  main tourist site and eating places. We will return to stay in the hotel again.

title: Great value for money
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Beautiful room
review: Having just come back from Florence this past weekend, I definitely recommend the J and J hotel.  I've visited Florence twice before, and found that Hotels can be a little unreliable. Despite often paying above the odds, hotels are often a little disappointing in terms of the rooms they offer. J and J is definitely the exception in this instance.   We booked the Junior Suite, with the room being great value for money, and a very comfortable stay.  On previous visits, I have chosen to stay very close to the centre of town near the Duomo, however with the extra few minutes walk to the J and J, you benefit from a better room at the same price.

title: Great luxury suite, great stay
review: This hotel is in a great location and is boutique style accommodation.  I believe the hotel is a converted convent.  The rooms are beautifully appointed and the bathroom is lovely.  Loads of marble and an enormous bath.  Staff are friendly but not obvious.  Breakfast is buffet in a beautiful room overlooking courtyard.

title: A small truly individual hotel with excellent service.
review: We spent 2 nights in this splendid hotel in Firenze city center. We were so lucky to find the suite in promotion so we could enjoy a really nice vacation. The breakfast is delicious and the staff is super friendly and pretty. definitely recommended!

title: Wonder Hotel with Great Location
review: A small truly individual hotel with excellent service in a quiet area within walking distance of all the sights and restauraunts. We first stayed here in 1999 and this was our first return visit, so it was good to find it was still here and had hardly changed. Very friendly, will come back whenever we return to Florence.

title: Charming Hotel in a quiet but convenient location
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Visit to Florence
review: The best part of this hotel is its location.  It is within walking distance of the Duomo, the Uffizi, the Accademia, Santa Croce, and many good restaurants, but it is on a quiet street away from the big hotels and most tourists.  The ceilings are high and the rooms are spacious, although our bathroom, particularly our shower, was tiny.  Service was friendly and very helpful.  Breakfast was good and was served in a beautiful, peaceful room.  My only complaints are (1) internet service was extremely slow and (2) our sheets were never changed, even though we stayed for over a week.  (We know because one of us accidentally made a pen mark on the second day.)  If you're looking for an atmospheric hotel in an excellent location, this is the hotel for you.

title: Discrete & Delightful
review: An absolute beauty of a hotel,my compliments to the owners for retaining the charm and character of the building.   services were delightful and we were very happy with the front office lady Laura, who was very charming and was always smiling and ready to help.   Excellent experience.   Thanks.  Sumant Tivary

title: Aristocratic
review: Tucked away yet close to the city centre this hotel is a real 'find'. We were so glad of the coolness of our very large room to return to after a day's sightseeing. The staff were all very friendly. All the basics worked well but it needs some redecorating both in public areas and in our bathroom. It is quaint and comfy though.

title: Quaint and convinent
review: Been here for vacations.Exellent location near the center of the town which can be reached by foot.Beautiful building.Undescribable decoration placing you in another époque.The deluxe room we booked was so pretty just couldn't get enough of if.The bathroom was clean and actually I have never seen such a beautiful decoration style.Everybody in the hotel(staff) were so helpful,so kind and very polite.I would definitely stay there again.And the breakfast room is very nice with nice little tables.The breakfast buffet good enough,had fresh fruits and many other goodies.

title: Great location, great atmosphere
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: special place, with improvements needed
review: This hotel is tucked away from the large crowds but close enough to get to the major attractions with a short walk, it is on a quiet street. The hotel entrance and sitting area is well presented and a tranquil place to sit. We were upgraded to a suite, and everything in the room was well presented.  You have to climb steep stairs to  mezzanine bed and side room; they were too steep.The bed needed replacing, we were both rolling to the centre of the bed throughout the night. The bathroom and sitting area was downstairs; there was no tea/coffee making facilities, but the bar person was happy to make anytime. The bathroom was spacious but one thing that challenged us was the shower water could not be contained and splashed items stored under the sink. Breakfast was adequate. Coffee…

title: Florence Hotel
review: This is a charming hotel, situated in the central area, within walking distance from the main attractions.  Everything looks old style, very nice. Internet is weak, almost non-existent. Breakfast is good, not with many options, but with good quality products. The staff is very attentive and willing to help. There are good toiletries, bathroom looks fine but needs adjustments (water from shower spills on the floor, there is no proper place for drying towels.

title: Gorgeous little place - Amazing value
review: Nice small hotel, right in the heart of the city.  We really enjoyed our stay here.  The room was not that large and it wasnt very modern by USA standards, but it felt just right for Florence.  The staff gets an A+ from us.  The patio was very nice for breakfast or for a glass of wine after a long day of travel.

title: Excellent hotel in city center
review: Dear Sir,            Thank you very much for staying with us and for your kind review. We are delighted to note that you had a pleasant stay and we look forward to welcoming you back next time.  Kind regards The Management

title: Charming hotel
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Quiet, Romantic Boutique
review: The J and J feels like a hidden gem.  It is decorated very tastefully, has an old charm to it but comfortable at the same time.  Every staff member was pleasant and happy to help everyone. We were in a large room because we had our children with us and it was really nice.  All I kept thinking about was how peaceful and romantic the hotel would be if it were just the two of us.  The bar was small and quaint and the breakfast was simple but well attended by the barista. The wifi in the room was not the best but it is an old building with thick walls. One warning is the stairs are steep and there is no elevator, however, it made it feel that more authentic to me.

title: Quiet and tasteful hotel
review: Dear Sir/Madam, We thank you very much for your feedback and we look forward to welcoming you next time.  Kind regards  The Management

title: Perfect
review: My wife and I stayed here for a friend's wedding.  Most of the guests stayed at fancier hotels in town, but we really enjoyed this place.  The service is nice and attentive, albeit that of a small hotel with limited staff.  That was fine by us as we were not expecting all the fuss.  The location is great to explore your way around town.  The rooms are all different and we stayed in a lovely junior sweet with very comfortable living area, bed and bath.

title: Not Impressed
review: Dear Sir/Madam, We thank you very much and we look forward to welcoming you next time.  Kind regards  The Management

title: Wonderful Hotel
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Adequate Hotel
review: Stayed in the beautiful J & J Hotel for four nights last week. Hotel was everything we expected. Beautiful period building. Room was tastefully decorated & had everything we required. Staff were friendly & helpful. The breakfast was fantastic from the lovely fresh fruit to an arrangement of breads,cheese & pasteries & fantastic coffee. Thank you for making our stay special & memorable.

title: Amazing one-off, characterful, boutique hotel.  Kind Staff
review: Dear Sir/Madam, Thank you very much for consideration and look forward to welcoming you in the future. Kind regards  The Management

title: Vacation of a lifetime
review: We found this hotel to be close enough to all the sites that were on our list of things to do. The rooms are clean but very bare. The bathroom was clean, but the shower had its challenges. Breakfast was enough, but would have liked to see some fresh vegetables, fresh buns and perhaps some fresh cut up fruit. The staff were very helpful.

title: Not the best but not the worst
review: Dear Sir/Madam, Thank you very much for choosing our hotel and that you as well for your point of view about the breakfast which has been taken into consideration.  Regards  The Management

title: Worth visiting
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Different but not necessarily good!
review: This hotel is a four star hotel, and it shows! The staff were very attentive, the room was kitted out really well, and we enjoyed our short city break here immensely. I would love to come back again. The breakfast was of the continental style, they did have bacon and eggs, but it would be best to try this at the start of breakfast rather than an hour later. Very cosmopolitan clientele here.

title: Is it a 4star hotel ?
review: We thank you very much. Kind regards  The Management

title: It Could Have Been Great !
review: This hotel is well located allowing for an easy walk to all the attractions of Florence. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms are all different and our room had two floors and was very spacious.  The bathroom was good and the water hot.  The bed was comfortable. However the rooms could do with refurbishment as they are a bit tired looking. Another big problem is that many of the rooms are located around an outside courtyard, our door opened on to it.  It is a pretty courtyard and a nice idea but, unless you go to bed in the early hours of the morning, sleep is not going to be an option as people obviously and understandably gather in the courtyard for social drinks and a chat etc - it was noisy even in March.  We had to keep the window closed and as the air…

title: Worth considering if you can get a deal.
review: The hotel is nicely located close to the Duomo and a 15 to 20 min walk from the trainstation. It is in a calm street and I've read that some people say it is in a bad neighbourhood but we didn't have any problems at all. The people at the reception were very friendly and helpfull. When we got our room we were dissapointed. It was room N° 1 on the groundfloor . Dirty carpet, just a shower (with a little sittingtub), a mezzanine you could get to by a spiral staircase and here you had a sofa and a warddrobe. A bit strange because it would have been difficult to get your suitcase upstairs.  Well we just wanted to wait and see. When we went to sleep we heard a really loud noise next to us. There was some kind of engineroom. We just couldn't get any sleep at all. So we phoned the…

title: A real surprise
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: just enough
review: really didn't know what to expect (birthday surprise for my better half) but I will sum up by asking, how many hotels have you stayed in? Followed by how many do you remember? Trust me you wont forget your stay here. Yes its in need of a bit of a spruce up and yes its a bit tired but trust me the whole is so much better than the sum of its parts. Staff were wonderful. Nothing too much trouble. Please don't get me wrong in this day and age wifi (which we found fine in our room) is important but pales once you walk out of the hotel turn left and enjoy what is a wonderful city. I will be back. Hint Turn right (cant remember the name) and the restaurant on the corner will deliver a meal that you will talk about for ages. Ask at the reception. Must go as im salivating over my…

title: Weekend break away
review: It is a small boutique hotel, charactiristic for Florence, another has-been property. I was there the first time 10 years ago, all in all the 10 years are showing. Service is friendly but unprofessional, good willing , hard working but untrained staff. Breakfast buffet is not good , the orange "drink " nothing to do with orange juice. The coffee, disappointing for Italy. Let's say it is just passable. The rooms, I had a junior suite, very spacious, high ceilings. The hotel setting an old, obviously much too old palazio. The area is a dirty back street , just 10 minutes walk to the center. Not worth a special effort to get there, but not really too disappointing either. I won't recommend it, because most people will find fault with it, different faults. For myself, I won't book…

title: Style over substance
review: . For my boyfriend birthday I decided to treat him to this beautiful city for 3 nights at the beginning of November and our first ever trip to Florence. My overall impression we were left with was that it was rather a very beautiful and romantic short break away. It is in a amazing location with some very nice bars and restaurants locally. We received an upgrade as requested by myself due to it being my boyfriend birthday which was a very nice touch from the hotel at arrival. The room was very big and welcoming which was very nice. I was very happy with it. The staff were wonderful, helpful and friendly. Totally recommend this hotel, peaceful and charming. Also brilliantly positioned a 10 minute walk from the heart of Florence and not far from the station.  I would come again.

title: Romantic & Beautiful
review: It was our honeymoon and we informed the hotel about this in April.   A really good hotel would have perhaps provided added extras. Nothing extra was provided and the staff were a little disinterested apart from one man on evening duty who was very nice and helpful.  The hotel is beautiful but there were some issues with our room. We stayed there for two weeks but towards the end of our stay there was an unpleasant smell coming from the bathroom sink.   The breakfast was very nice with a good selection of food to choose from.   Right at the end we were told about tourist tax which was a nasty surprise that hadn't been budgeted for. Perhaps the staff could have made us aware of this upon our arrival so we could factor it in.   Not a bad hotel by any means but considering our…

title: 2 nights at the J & J
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Location good
review: My 20 year old daughter & myself stayed here for 2 nights in July. It was a lovely building with character and the staff were very friendly & helpful. However, our room was not one of which there is a photo on the website - it was nothing like those on the website at all ! It was just ok but very small and somewhat disappointing with a view of a brick wall out of the back. I had been looking forward to the luxury I was expecting in our room from the website photos but I was really disappointed with the room. Our room was up an old narrow spiral staircase at the back of the hotel which was not too great with my mobility problems.  The WiFi also did not work well in our room. The hotel location is ideal to walk to the cathedral and to all sights. I wouldn't advise driving in…

title: Quirky, well located hotel
review: Dear Sir/Madam, We thank you very much for having chosen our hotel for your stay and we are very sorry about the inconvenience caused concerning the room choice. As you already know, the building was a convent of the 16th century which has been converted into a hotel. That is why all the rooms are different from each other. Moreover it depends as well on the category of room you booked. Anyway if you had reported this problem at the reception desk on the check in day, we could have changed the room for you or if you did so and we were unable to change the room for you, this was because we had no availability. So we are sorry again and we look forward to welcoming you in the future.  Best regards

title: Weekend in Florence
review: Stayed for a couple of nights. Location great, room shabby and dark, had a very strange two floor layout with spiral stone steps leading upstairs like in churches. Door and windows opened directly onto courtyard where people ate on ground floor, had to be very careful when we switched the lights on! Breakfast ok. Parking very expensive although secure.

title: NICE MEMORIES
review: Dear Sir/Madam,               We thank you very much for having chosen our hotel for your stay in Florence. Concerning the room description "like in churches", we agree with you as the building was a convent of the 16th century. Fortunately  we immagine that these are only personal opinions & comments as for the majority of our guests, the room is awesome. This is because before making a reservation, they already know about the history of the building but sometime it happens that who comes here don't know anything about how the hotels is like. Anyway we thank you very much and we would like to have you again among our guests next time.  Best regards

title: Looks lovely but not great value for money
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Peaceful Florence Hotel
review: We booked this for its central location and ambiance. We had one terrific man at reception but the others were disinterested and lazy...really made a difference. Rooms small, no English speaking t.v...poor for the price!

title: This hotel is a must when in Florence
review: This is a gorgeous hotel down a quiet street very near the Duomo and walking distance to many great restaurants. It has a lovely courtyard which you can relax in and have a drink. The rooms are decorated beautifully and you can tell there has been real care and attention to detail with the interior design. The staff are very friendly and we had a lovely breakfast each morning. This is a true little boutique hotel.

title: A gem in Florence
review: I can't say enough about how enjoyable my stay was at Hotel J & J. I stayed for 6 nights and would have stayed another 6 nights!  First, this hotel is like walking into a very well appointed home that was prepared just for you. Every little detail was perfect. The comfy sofas and chairs throughout, the books, lighting, rooms, beds, breakfast in the morning and so on. The staff was very attentive and accommodating. Richard at the front desk was great.   The rooms were nicely appointed as well. We stayed in room 12 and it had a lovely terrace if you wanted to step out in the morning to have a nice up of coffee or tea. It was a nice little sanctuary in the morning and evening hours.  The hotel is conveniently located to the Domus and other attractions. Many shops, restaurants and…

title: not as the pictures
review: I have stayed here on three prior occasions in 2012 and returned this May.  This is truly a wonderful place with accomodating staff, excellent breakfast and comfortable rooms. No request was too much for the staff.  I have stayed now in 4 different rooms and they are all more than adequate with clean bathrooms, antique furnishings, and exude the charm of an old inn.My only warning is that one must be strong to get up the stairs to many of the rooms.  If not, request a ground floor accomodation.  Look forward to a return visit.

title: Wonderfull
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Style over substance
review: As you walk into the reception you see this is not just another 4* hotel, the furnishings are exquisite 2 Large sofas await and you are met by a very welcoming receptionist and you are taken through the dinning room into a courtyard where the smell of Jasmine knocks you back, heavenly. Into your room in our case off the courtyard the main room with the bathroom off and in the corner a old stone staircase leading up to a mezzanine with a comfortable chair and a wardrobe. The furniture was all beautiful and the room spotless. Breakfast was simple but adequate with scrambled egg and bacon. We came back to the hotel in the evening after our evening meal and would sit in the courtyard smelling the Jasmine and having a last drink of the day, heaven.

title: Great value and location
review: A beautiful historic building tastefully renovated and furnished does not automatically make a great hotel. The place appears to be run by junior staff with a limited understanding of the hospitality business. With so much competition in this city service needs to be impeccable and the breakfast more than just a few packets and jars from the supermarkets opened.   We had a room on the first floor which had a nice "trendy" looking bathroom which was not fit for purpose (shower flooded bathroom as glass screen too small and water didn't drain from sink down the designer slit plug hole...). Internet service was a joke (we got reception sitting on one cushion of the sofa in the sitting room but not the one next to it).  This is nothing more than a well-placed over-priced bolt hole.…

title: Charming place
review: This was an excellent choice of a 4 star hotel with good location in a studentish part of centre of Florence.  Near enough to everything.  Rooms are all different so check them out first - go far junior suite if you can

title: historical building, good location
review: The J and J hotel is is a real charming place. Central but in a calm area , chic and discreet. Rooms are very conforable and very well decorated and furnished. The staff is nice and helpful. Perfect for a romantic escape or to stay in an historic place but away from touristic crowd.

title: great find
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Very nice!
review: The Hotel J and J is a terrific gem.  About 10 minute walk to the Duomo it is close enough to the sights but away from all the crowds, etc.  The staff was extremely helpful.  The rooms very spacious! And By Florence standards, a very good deal for what you get.   No elevator.

title: Cozy, but...
review: I like everything and of course I will come back)the rooms are Stylish,staff are friendly,location is great.very nice hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Bad managment Bad experience
review: Overall, It was a pleasant boutique hotel (only 21 rooms) with a convenient location. The rooms are generally comfortable, and maintains the historic feel. I feel it's worth the price.   A few minor issues...  1. Food is not allowed in the room.  Huge inconvenience when you are traveling alone, and you decide to bring back a pizza to enjoy while you work. You may eat your food in the dining room for a fee. Who wants to pay to eat  when you've already bought your food. Very peculiar policy.   2. Keys must be returned to the front desk each time you leave (even to run next door and back), and the front door is locked later in the evening. IT's a bit inconvenient, as staff doesn't always answer the door promptly, and you may spend about five minutes in the ally waiting.  3. Wifi -…

title: Great Location
review: Arrived at hotel to join a party of friends who'd travelled from the UK to find the hotel had shunted me into another hotel along the street and round the corner, obviously having seen mine was a single booking so it wouldn't have mattered to them where I stayed. No effort was made to contact me beforehand, no effort was made to remedy their problem nor could I speak to the director of the hotel, only the front desk staff who were apologetic but didn't want to find a solution where the 3 of us could stay together. Neither in a suite for 3 nor in the other hotel, he said we could go if we wanted to but not at their expense. Then he ranted a raved about how their hotel doesn't receive the money that I'd already paid for another month. I imagine they're having financial problems to…

title: Good choice in the centre of Firenze
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: nice hotel , parking over priced !!!
review: Very nice und spacious room in a historic house close to the centre of Firenze, service could be more ambiguous, breakfast was okay but not really 4* level, but overall  a good choice for a faire price.

title: Wonderful wedding venue!
review: cool hotel , nice cleen and big rooms. internet is fast , bathroom was nice and cleen. very romantic hotel ;) very good service , location was perfect !!  5 mins walk from "the dome" and close to " bet habad " :) the only  problem is the parking . 30 euro per day ?!?!?!?  so if you are with a car, i dont think this hotel is good for you.

title: A unique historical stay in Florence
review: My family and friends recently stayed at the J and J for our daughters wedding in Florence.  From the moment we arrived until the moment we left we were made to feel more than welcome, and there was nothing that was too much for the staff to do for us. The rooms we cleaned and aired everyday and a pleasure to stay in.  Every guest was extremely happy with their rooms. We stayed in one of the dramatic, enormous and beautiful suites.  Some are obviously much bigger than others,  some are nicer, but as this is an old building (which has THANKFULLY not been 'converted' or 'modernised') so what you get is originality.  Our breakfast was not the best I have ever had in a four star hotel but it was perfectly ok with nothing to complain about and we were very happy with it.  The staff…

title: Historic in more sense than one!
review: I was in Florence for a short trip and was inspired to stay at J and J for the simple reason that it  was a convent. I had the room way at the top of the stairs and found it the be a spacious and peaceful stay. I found the location to be very convenient to some interesting sites and great restaurants. I would recommend the hotel for those that are interested in a spot that is more unique, historical than luxurious.

title: J or not too J that is the question
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Nice hotel off the beaten path
review: I have never written anything like this before, as hotels and restaurants are subjective to different tastes, so I shall enter the facts. The location, for walking into Florence was great, although area abit shabby.  If you have a car, the hotel parking is 30 euros a day, also going in and out of Florence costs more money, and tourist tax 4 euros a day each. The breakfast area was nice, but Internet really slow... And you have to get code every 24 hours to log in, then sit in corner of front reception to pick up signal, this is all very petty, especially as most people staying wanted to pick up their emails. We called our room, 'the prison' as it was dark and damp, being on the ground floor, just off courtyard, you could not open curtains, as people in courtyard could look in,…

title: Perfect Anniversary
review: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon.  The room was large.  The staff were very nice; on our second morning there we came down to breakfast five minutes after it technically ended but the waiter did not rush us at all.  In fact, he made us fresh coffee and brought out items that he was starting to put away.  It was very accommodating.  This hotel was in a nice location -- it was away from the tourists but a short walk to the heart of Florence.

title: City Break Florence
review: We have recently returned from Florence after celebrating our 1st wedding anniversary.   I booked the J&J Hotel on a little bit of a whim in December, and kept looking on Tripadvisor until our trip in May, I was getting a little worried that the hotel was not as perfect as described due to some recent reviews however on arriving all of these worries were dispelled.  After a short taxi journey from the main train station we arrived in a quiet back street at the J&J. We were greeted by a friendly man who made us feel very welcome and showed us to our room. We stayed in room 1 which was better than expected. There was a lovely mezzanine floor and everything that we required for our 3 night stay (including a well stocked mini bar). The features of the room and the whole hotel are …

title: city break
review: Brillianr location for seeing the sites of Florence, far enough away from the crowds but close enough to walk to the centre easily. The room was large and very clean with excellent quality bedding, the downside was that the room was on the ground floor in the courtyard so therefore exposed to cigarette smoke and the noise of late night smokers. The room was also very dark so whilst in the room the lights needed to be constantly on.  Breakfast was a total disappointment, everything had to be asked for as it had either run out or not been put out, simple things such as tea bags, rolls and the scrambled eggs. The fruit juice was totally watered down and tasted awful. Staff serving breakfast were very unhappy in their work unlike reception staff who couldn't do enough to help,…

title: DO NOT TRUST ALL YOU SEE WHEN YOU GOOGLE THIS HOTEL
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Somewhat disappointing.
review: On arrival staff were more than helpful.    The room was dark and narrow and we had to walk down a flight of stairs to a large bathroom.  On complaining that the room was too hot we were told that the air-con had not been activated so far, they were unable to turn off heating thus the room & bathroom were very uncomfortable.  On asking for a different room we were told that the hotel was completely full.  The double bed was in need of change as it dipped in the middle, but the standard of sheets, towels etc were 1st class and everything was spotless.    The main rooms of this hotel are a credit to them - clean and homely and in-keeping with the character that the hotel must of been when originally a monastery.

title: Just beautiful
review: Four nights in April and out first ever trip to Florence, expectations ran quite high for this 4 star Hotel but the overall impression we were left with was that it rather overrates itself. It is a good location but most of the staff seemed rather disinterested. Soundproofing in our room at least was poor, with a big gap under the door and a construction that meant that any scrape along the floor in adjacent rooms disturbed us. Beds also squeaked at the slightest movement and we had to use (good) earplugs every night to sleep reasonably and not get woken up prematurely.   The other main disappointment was the breakfast with staff inadequate and long waits for a rather meagre spread of items to be replenished. The fruit juice was very watered down (another couple asked for…

title: 10 Days in Florence
review: Dear Sir,   First of all we thank you very much for having stayed at our hotel. We are very sorry that it appeared to you that the staff seemed to be disinterested and inadequate but unfortunately for me it is not like this as you can verify by yourself, we receive many positive reviews on our staff efficiency and courtesy. That is why I have the same group of persons working here for more than 25 years.  Concerning the soundproof of the room I am sorry to inform you that is not possibile  to make any amendment on it as the building itself was a convent of the 15th century, declared at the commission for the Architectural Heritage and having the plasterwork of that time.  Thank you for your comment on the breakfast as I always try to give the best to my clients and many things are fresh and prepared at home. It is normal that if somebody wants something extra that is not included in the continental buffet, for example the fresh squeeze orange juice, this will have an extra cost.  Thank you The Owner, Mrs Jacqueline Cavagnari

title: Great Stay at the Hotel J&J
review: Spent the first part of our honeymoon here. Just gorgeous,romantic place decorated in tones of cream, black and other neutrals. Short cab ride from the train station.  Good neighborhood in the Santa Croce area. This was more of a residential than tourist arrea (nice and quiet at night)  but still within walking distance of shopping, attractions,  restaurants (great place just a few doors down).  Comfortable lobby, lovely breakfast room with wonderful buffet style breakfasts, gracious service, reading room and courtyard. Our room (8) was HUGE with suite area and enormous terra cotta shower and antiques. The only weird thing about the bathroom was the shower stall (size of a small room) had no light and no ledge for toiletries The space was a medieval convent so there were lots of…

title: So relaxing, pleasant, peaceful (J and J Historic House)
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Simple...Staying in Florence?...Stay here!
review: I was at the end of my Italy trip (3 months) and what a wonderful way to end it. Because I had already had my share of less-than-adequate accommodations, my breath was taken away when I walked into my room -- Room No. 1. A quaint balcony with a winding stairway inside my room, a large comfortable bed, cozy seating either upstairs in the balcony overlooking the bedroom or downstairs, a lovely ample bathroom (with a shower curtain -- I noticed another reviewer didn't have a shower curtain), television with too many channels from which to choose.  Just outside my room, was a courtyard with several tables, and then easy access to a very comfortable sitting area and dining area of the hotel.  The staff were generous with their help and good attitude. I had a lot of luggage and they…

title: A real taste of Florence
review: Stayed here for 2 nights and wow what a hotel one of the best we have ever had the pleasure of staying in!  We where lucky enough to have a lovely room/Italian home on the courtyard. When we walked in the room was romantically lit, lovely old wood and beautiful curtains tied back throughout and an amazing archway to the bathroom. Bathroom had a lovely big back with huge showerhead over it perfect wake up call before the buffet breakfast!  Superb hotel not too far from everything in Florence but tucked away from all the hussle and Bustle!   Loved every second, if you are going to Florence dont think twice just stay here and ask for room 2! (even the woman behind the counter said it was a nice room)

title: Great location, if they change a couple of things could be awesome
review: We recently stayed at the J and J Hotel and have to say there was very little to fault with this hotel. Although the hotel is hidden down a side street, it is easily within strolling distance of all the major sights and restaurants in Florence. Our room was spacious with an enormous and luxurious bathroom and with patio doors leading out onto a little terrace that given better weather would have been fantastic! Breakfast was simple but more than adequate, and we found the staff always extremely friendly and more than willing to help with booking restaurants etc.

title: Superb Hotel
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Absolutely loved this place!
review: The room was spacious, bathroom modern and both were spotlessly clean. The whole hotel was tastefully furnished. The staff were friendly,and very helpful. The breakfast was excellant with many choices. The location was just right. Not right in the centre but in with the local community and only 10 minutes walk from places of interest.An excellant hotel and one we would highly recommend.

title: Amazing room,location,price....
review: The rooms are extremely spacious and the rural feel is unique. The service is good and the breakfast delicious. It's located right in the middle of everything. It's NOT right in the tourist centre, but near all the local bars and restaurants. Only 10 minutes walk to the main attractions though. I'd definitely stay here again!

title: Perfect for our needs
review: The room was beautiful with an enormous bed, tasteful decoration and a couch and seating in a lounge area to seat 4 people, definitely felt more like a suite than a 'standard double'! The bathroom was clean and modern and bathrobes provided added a bit more luxury. The breakfast had a good choice of pastries,fruit,cereal,ham/cheese/bread and there is a picturesque courtyard for warmer weather!  We read in the room details that the usual room price was 440 euros,so felt an absolute bargain at the 75 euros we paid!

title: Beautiful Hotel
review: When we travel, we enjoy being in another place. During the week we were in Florence we were out an about. We only spent enough time in our room to shower and sleep. The Hotel J and J was perfect. It was out of the mainstream tourist craziness, but within a five minute walk to the Duomo. The morning breakfast was great for both American and non-American tastes. The J and J is well worth consideration if you plan a visit to Florence.

title: It 's an okay hotel
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: J and J Delivers
review: Depending on how much you pay, this is a good hotel vs not okay.  No internet on the rooms, which is really annoying. 300 channels of TV but not one in English. Room was huge but poorly furnished, musty and had one small window that looked into the smallest courtyard imaginable so the entire room was just very dark.  Bath was the nicest feature but had this very loud exhaust fan contraption that turned on and stated on if you even looked at the bathroom light switch. Oh, it would stay on for several minutes after you turn the light off.  I began using the bathroom in the dark.

title: Most Incredible hotel room ever
review: J and J hotel is nestled in the back streets not too far from the centre of Florence. To look at the hotel from the outside you would easily and mistakingly feel a bit disappointed at the place. Once you get inside the hotel it is like a little alladins cave with vaulted ceilings old yet tasteful furnishings.  The rooms are clean throughout and well sized when compared to a few hotels that we stayed at during our weeks stay in Tuscany.  The staff can't do enough for you! No problem is too small so just make sure that you turn up ready to enjoy yourself.  Trust me you will leave the place smiling.

title: Great stay
review: My husband, son and I traveled to Florence in May of 2012. The Hotel J and J was recomended to me by a coworker. It was fabulous. We had a Junior suite and it was HUGE. My husband said it was about 750 sq ft. Very comfortable. 2 twin beds, 2 pull out couches, desk, side boards and it was air conditioned! We also had excellent wireless internet. I chose all our hotels because they were centrally located to the sites and the hotel J and J did not disappoint. Very easy to walk to all the sites. Hotel staff were also very attentive. Allowed us to have breakfast early because we had to meet an early tour. Arranged tours for us. Very accomodating. The Hotel J and J was wonderful on every level - we would definitely stay again.

title: Charming Hotel in the Heart of Old Florence
review: We chose the non-refundable classic room option (clearly explained on the website). After an initial mix up with a previous option no longer available, an extremely helpful employee (Richard) upgraded us to the Deluxe room for no extra charge. What can we say, a fantastic spacious room at the front of the hotel, with modern bathroom, excellent air conditioning (needed with the high temps in August), and extremely clean. Fresh towels and sheets were provided/laid on a daily basis.  It was a beautiful hotel, situated in an ideal, quiet location. In my opinion, a hidden gem on a plain looking Florentine street. The main attractions were all in easy walking distance.  The breakfast was quite varied and we particularly enjoyed the option of breakfast cake. Breakfast included: fruit,…

title: Buyer beware
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Charming old and centrally located hotel in old Florence
review: Be extremely careful when booking with this hotel. When you select a room online, there is no mention that it is non-refundable, and the terms and conditions are misleading as they tell you cancellation can be made 48hrs in advance... you'll find that you can't cancel and you're only told it is a non-refundable rate AFTER they take payment.  A hotel that is unwilling to accept cancellations with 3 weeks notice, and uses misleading terms and conditions, suggests they are not confident in filling the rooms - I can understand why having read some of the other reviews.

title: Great location, pleasant hotel
review: The Hotel J and J is an old, charming,  and pleasantly quirky hotel.  I enjoyed it but this place isnt for everyone.  I would highly recommend it for the type of traveler who can appreciate it and enjoy its charms. The hotel is a very old and  tranquil hotel in a centrally located part of florence.  You are within walking distance of many of the major sites.   There is a small courtyard in the middle of the hotel filled with flowers; a great place to take tea or coffee in the morning.  The rooms are very clean but also old and filled with antiques.  I was very comfortable here.   If you are looking for a modern five star hotel with impeccable service, the kind which will make you feel like you are in New York or Milan, this is not it.   However, if you are willing to enjoy the…

title: Fantastic!!
review: Was this the best hotel I've ever stayed in? In short, no. However, its location was excellent, the staff were pleasant and friendly, the rooms had everything we needed (and were clean) and for 3 nights in Florence it suited us!  The lobby and court yard is very pretty and attractive.  Yes there isn't any wi fi in the rooms, but who wants to be on the Internet when you have Florence on your doorstep?  The breakfast was adequate and the coffee was amazing.  Upon arrival my girlfriend was called Sir on two occasions which wasn't ideal and when we asked for a recommendation on where we could have good beer in a great setting, we were pointed in the direction of a pretty grim Irish pub - says a lot on what Italians think of us Brits!! We were in room 2, which opened up in to the…

title: Terrible hotel in a bad area
review: By far one of the best places we stayed in!  From the beginning we found this hotel to be wonderful. Patel, at the front desk, was friendly and welcoming. Our Rooms were outstanding. (Rooms 11 and 13) They were on the ground floor just past the open dining area. We booked a standard room as well as a suite. The basic room was beautiful with a beautiful doors that opened to a shared courtyard. The suite was enormous and was beautiful as well. The bathrooms were immaculate and modern. the furniture and bedding was top notch. Very comfortable! The eating/lobby area is very pretty with a wonderful rustic open air feel to it. Every night we would enjoy a bottle of wine in this ideal setting. Breakfast was great! I also liked the fact that you can request anything throughout the day…

title: no elevator!!!
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Clean, helpful, friendly, great location.
review: the hotel was nice and the decoration was amazing, the main issue is the elevator!! my parents are old and when we asked them to change the room they said we are fully booked. in the reviews there were nothing written about the elevator so that's was the real problem, I wouldn't consider it as a 4 star hotel! espicially that it was very expensive!!!

title: Very nice place
review: Quiet street, just had a standard room (number 16) which was basic enough but had everything you needed - wardrobe, drawers, air con, comfy beds and pillows. Bathroom was lovely with bath inc a powerful and hot shower, very happy with that. Breakfast lovely, plenty of choice although eggs not always the warmest but delicious. Staff very helpful with whatever we asked so would encourage other visitors to ask and also for restaurant recommendations. I would definitely recommend the hotel and would love to go back and try one of their snazzier rooms when I  am rich!

title: A disappointing experience
review: a very nice surprise. This hotel has great character, nice decor and friendly staff. An overall positive feeling. Highly recommended

title: Delightful J&J
review: A friend and I recently returned from a trip to Florence, 24th-27th May.  We stayed and the Jand J hotel which we had chosen on the strength of the recommendations both on Trip Advisor and in various guide books. We had decided to book a suite which was a very considerable financial outlay for both of us. When we arrived at the hotel we were taken through to the back of the hotel and and up two flights of dingy stairs which smelled of damp. We were shown into our suite which was dreadful. It was a large dark dank split level room. It did not seem to have been used for quite a long time. It was furnished hapharsadly with bits of old furniture which provided neither function nor comfort. The overall impression was of an impoverished hostel. We decided we were not staying in this…

title: quiet, central, boutique, out of the ordinary
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: A pleasant surprise.
review: I booked this for three nights via BA. I was generally favourably impressed. There aren't many rooms. All of them (I think) look out over one of several small courtyards, to which the ground floor rooms have direct access. The rooms are charming, spacious, with high ceilings, and interesting modern decor that doesn't clash with the old building (former monastery). Beds are large, but are of the two twins make a double variety. The bathrooms are vast, but probably designed by a woman, as the mirrors aren't high enough and there's not enough light to shave. Aircon wasn't working, which gives you a choice between sweltering or accommodating the local mosquitoes. Manageable in May, but not in July I suspect. Breakfast is well above average, except the scrambled egg which, as ever,…

title: This is a four-star hotel ??
review: This hotel has many positives and just a couple of minor negatives…  The positives are: •	The super friendly, professional, helpful, and polite front desk. •	The gorgeous hotel room we had. This hotel is an old monastery so, we weren’t sure what to expect.  The room was spacious, beautiful, and comfortable. •	The bathroom was spacious and had all the amenities you need.  Double sinks, robes, etc.  I did find it odd that they didn’t provide shampoo or more than one bar of soap (two are always nice - shower and sink) but, I brought my own shampoo and conditioner so this wasn’t a big deal for us.  •	The location is very convenient to everything.  We only took a taxi to and from the train station.  Other than that we accessed everything on foot with ease.  The Duomo is the closest…

title: French Country Cottage in Florence
review: As our taxi pulled up to the J&J I was impressed with the location and the welcoming lobby, then reality set in. There is no elevator. I was fine climbing the two flights to our "superior double room," but after proceeding along an outside gallery I was shocked to see that we faced ANOTHER stairway of TWENTY narrow stairs to get up to our room. Heat rises (and this was in mild late April) and the room was stifling. While large, it was shabby and furnished with what looked like purchases from a garage sale, and NOTHING like the photos posted on the hotel website. I descended the three flights of to question the guy at the desk who told me that the online photos are of their suite. I told him I was shocked by their misrepresentation and the prices they were charging for a dumpy…

title: Best boutique hotel experience i have ever had.
review: We stayed in the J&J Historic House Hotel for two nights, but we enjoyed the casual atmosphere.  The hotel is on the east side of the city center, and was a quick walk to everything we wanted to see in Florence.  They had very nice evening snacks for guest along with a nice bar.  It rained while we were there so we did not get to enjoy the coutryard with French country decor.  The our room was two story, we a lovely wood stair case to the bed and separate room.  The bed, was hard as a rock, we both woke up sore and tired.  The pillows weren't any softer.  The separate room held the room safe, which was just sitting on a shelf, not attached, so we didn't use it.  The in room refrigerator was hidden in the closet under the stairs, but we didn't really need it.  The very modern…

title: Charming with a great location!
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Worth a stay
review: If you want a charming place to stay that has a convenient location, stay here! The hotel has so much character and history but it is conveniently located in a quiet neighborhood that is still close to all of the main attractions in Florence.   The lobby, eating area, sunroom, and patio are nicely decorating in what I would consider a French country mixed with shabby chic style. We had room four which was huge! It had a comfortable king bed and a siting area with two love seats. It had a huge window overlooking the courtyard.  I would definitely recommend this room.   The bathroom was a good size too. The water was hot but the water pressure low. They have comfy slippers and robes available for use.   The walls are somewhat thin but luckily we didn't have any noisy neighbors.…

title: Extremely helpful and well located
review: We chose this hotel from Trip Advisor rather late after previous arrangements for staying with our extended family fell through.  Looking at the photographs we went for a deluxe room, expecting at our age to maybe need to sit and rest on occasion.  We were disappointed therefore to find only a single desk chair in the room (No 6).  That is, however, our only complaint.  Otherwise this interesting hotel met all our expectations, friendly,  convenient and very quiet at night. There is an excellent restaurant a minutes walk down the road and others nearby.

title: Solid Choice
review: We spent 3 nights in March 2012 and we enjoyed the relaxing atmosphere of this boutique hotel. It has a superb location just five minute walk from the main Cathedral, shopping area and restaurants. Staff is extremely polite and helpful, rooms are tastefully decorated and spacious. Breakfast was lovely although not a lot of choice. Free internet was a welcome extra. The only problem was the leaking shower. There is a small panel and no shower curtain so all the water when you shower leaks on to the floor creating an incredible mess everywhere including the bedroom. Water does not dry for days so we had to ask the maid to mop our bathroom every day.

title: Great ambiance and location
review: Rooms are clean and QUIET... We met  tourists staying right downtown, and they couldn't get a good nights sleep, where we had no problem.  We walked 10-15 minutes to the major attractions like the Uffizi and the Duomo.  Service is average overall, except for Monica (at the front desk) who is a superstar.

title: Former monastery, not plush but nice.
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Excellent location, staff, and comfort
review: My wife and I spent Christmas and NY 2012 celebrations here. We stayed at "J and J" for 6 nights. This small hotel used to be a monastery so don't expect plush and extravagant interiors. We had a junior suite that had a living area with the bathroom at the lower level and a bedroom with a walk-in closet at the upper level. This setup is not bad and looks romantic, but it gets a bit inconvenient at night when you have to use the facilities located one flight of stairs lower than your bed. Particularly relevant, if you have somebody who is pregnant  up there (my wife was in her 4 month and she did frequent the toilet!). The view from our room was what one could expect from a hotel in an old city center. Our room was clean, although the skyline window leaked once during a storm.…

title: It just made Florence all the more special
review: We spent from Christmas to New Year 2011 at the J and J. We loved the quiet location, so close to the major sights, and we found the staff to be superb. .For instance, no public transit runs on New Year's Day and taxi companies do not take bookings. The desk clerk found us a cab for the early morning trip to the airport.   My wife has worked for Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton and is very knowledgeable about hotels. It passed all of her tests!

title: Great Location, Quaint Hotel
review: The J&J made our trip to Florence all the more special.  It is only a short distance away from the Duomo and close to a number of interesting places.  It was a lovely surprise! A converted monastery, complete with frescoes, even in our room.  Simply picture-perfect in every sense.

title: Great hotel in a Great area
review: Had a nice stay at the J&J. It's only a short stroll to some of the best resturants in Florence. We found it within easy walking distance of all the major Florence sights , and only 15 mins walk from the station. The hotel it's self was in a narrow side street. It looks small and unimpressive from the outside , but once inside it's very quaint. Staff were more than helpful with a great breakfast and as mentioned before, free wine in the evening before you venture out to fab resturants. This is not a hotel for someone who likes the "Major hotel " experience, but it was just what we were looking for. We were initially dissapointed by our room ( room 20 ) but we had booked using travel points so maybe other rooms were better ( they looked a bit more upmarket on the web site ).…

title: Excellent
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Great Historic Hotel with Fantastic Service
review: My favorite hotel on our trip. Very helpful staff. Large, clean room. Free wine in the evenings. Very nice breakfast. It was an Oasis after many 3 star hotels! Close walk to the main site in Florence. We will be back!

title: Near sites but on quieter street
review: My hubby and I stayed in a number of amazing hotels while we were exploring Italy and the J and J Historic House was definitely one of our favorites. When we drove up, I’ll admit I was a bit scared. Located on a tiny side street and somewhat off the beaten path. My husband warned me not to judge a book by its cover, and thankfully I didn’t. The inside was welcoming and warm; we were greeted by a happy staff that immediately made us feel at home. J and J was converted from a convent and updated with all the modern amenities one could possibly need. Cool. Weird. Fabulous. We were upgraded to a massive room with high ceilings, a living room and a huge bed. Thank you LuxLyfe! The breakfast was fresh and tasty with local fruits, breads, cheeses and pastries. Every night there was…

title: Great Hotel with a Great Location!
review: Wound up here after a travel company booking issue left us stranded at the last minute.  This quaint hotel is in an historic building in Florence but is away from the big crowds on a narrow, quiet street.  It is within walking distance to the Duomo, Uffizi, and other main tourist sites in Florence even for someone who is fairly fit but who does not exercise regularly.  It was also very near the synagogue and a kosher restaurant. Short walk to one of the highest rated gelato places in Florence!  I would stay here again.  Not easily accessible for anyone with significant mobility impairment like wheelchair or crutches.

title: Run and DON'T look back!
review: This is an amazing Hotel.  It is a former abbey that has been turned  into a hotel with character.  We had three rooms with the best room being room #10.  It takes up th entire top floor!  It was huge but with lots and lots of stairs.  The other two rooms were also very nice.  Staff was helpful and the breakfast was very good.  Stay here to have easy access to Florence downtown.  Take your GPS!  Very hard to find.

title: not bad
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: A wonderful place
review: My mother and I stayed here after finding that many of our first choice hotels here fully booked. We were not sure what to expect, but the price was a bargain at the time. We found the hotel to be a pleasant surprise. The breakfast was fine, nothing over the top, but if you want an over the top breakfast, we would go to a restaurant that was known for that. The rooms were large, but sparsely decorated. That didn't bother us. The bathroom was very large, which was a plus. There was a lovely courtyard off our room. The location didn't wow me. It was a bit of a walk into city center, and I couldn't tell if we were in a sketchy part of town or not. The front desk was not particularly helpful, but we didn't really need too much from them anyway. If the price of the hotel is near the…

title: Charming hotel with patio areas, but 15 minute walk to town
review: The hotel is great... staff is very helpfull and very friendly. Rooms are very very nice. The hotel sitting areas are magnificent, and breakfast was good.

title: Unique hotel in centre of Florence
review: I stayed 2 nights at the Hotel J and J in May, 2011.  This is a charming hotel with cozy lounging/breakfast area and nice patios.  The rooms are good sized, with good bathroom amenities, but I had no bathtub.  The furniture is not top quality, but the bed was comfy.  It's an OK location, about 15 minute walk to town.  The desk staff is very nice and super accomodating.  The breakfast was quite nice, with scrambled eggs, fresh fruit, juice, pastries and cakes.  There was door slamming noise, and not super insulated walls, but an enjoyable stay.  I enjoyed sitting on the beautiful patio with a cocktail.

title: It doesn't look like the photos - needs repainting
review: This is a very nice boutique hotel with spacious rooms and nice room and lobby decor. The staff were friendly with good recommendations for restaurants and sight seeing activities. The only complaint we had was regarding Wifi - the service was very slow and only accessible in the lobby. The hallways were also a bit smelly.

title: Excellent Hotel
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Peaceful and quirky
review: We had a magic stay at J and J. We were upgraded free of charge to a junior suite without us even asking. The room was magical as if you are taken back to the the early years of the convant. The hotel is nicely situated within walking distance of all the attractions. Friendly staff from Chacho the owners little dog to all the staff. Good breakfast. The hotel is close to the best restuarant for Florentine Bistec at Baldovinos. Thank you again

title: Part of the city
review: We had a one night stay in the J&J hotel, we had a lovely room which overlooked the courtyard, the hotel is well furnished with antiques and has a cosy feel about it.
