My only criticism would be that the breakfast was quite limited - no fresh orange juice, but otherwise a good find in Florence

title: Fantasic bargain
review: The J and J is great and totally different to anywhere i have previously stayed.  In a good location within easy walking distance of the sites it was the perfect base for our break.  THe weekend trip to Florence was a wedding present and hence we had not chosen the hotel but as soon as we walked in were were pleased.  Unique in every way.  We stayed in room 2 whoch was just off the court yard.  In the day it was a little dark but other than that perfect.  Great powerful shower, really comfrotable bed and nice big room.  The only negative to the whole thing was that being off the courtyard we were awoken by other guest when they came back late at night and also disturbed during the day - it did feel like people were actually in our room having a conversation.  Breakfast was good…

title: Former monastery gives this hotel an interesting feel
review: We stayed in May 2010. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Great location and an inner/upclass suburb away from crowds,central and easy walking distance to everything.  Booked a late deal for 3 nights, and were upgraded upon arrival to a junior suite.  Very spacious rooms with good bathroom amenities. Staff was help, with great food recommendations.  Breakfast was the only let down, limited choices but satisfactory

title: Quaint, Charming, and Cozy
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: A gem in Florence
review: My husband and I recently traveled to Italy to celebrate our 35th Wedding Anniversary. We chose this hotel on a friend's recommendation and would gladly return. From our first step inside we thought we had found a hidden treasure. The staff was always friendly but Deepak was especially helpful from the moment we arrived. My husband accidentally left his backpack in the taxi and Deepak was able to track it down and have it returned within 20 minutes. He also helped with directions, reservations for dinner & our biking trip in the Tuscany region. Breakfast was lovely and the common areas were comfortable and inviting. I would probably recommend a room in the newer section. For anyone interested, there is a synagogue within walking distance as well as a Chabad House.

title: Not for the business traveller.
review: Booked a 3 night stay but was extended by an extra 4 nights because of volcanic eruption. Hotel and staff, especially Deepak and Peiris could not have done more to alleviate our inconvenience. They were extremely helpful with whatever was asked of them.The hotel was spacious, tastefully decorated and furnished and was just to our taste. Breakfast was very good and in a pleasant environment. Hotel in a quiet location but only a short distance walk from the hustle and bustle of the centre. We would not hesitate in highly recommending this hotel to anyone.

title: Great!
review: The reviews for this hotel were so positive, that we changed from another hotel to here.  I was amazed when I walked in how dark the hotel looked compared to the publicity images, and that feeling never left. It was winter, but I like a bit more light in a hotel. The use of the internal small courtyard in summer may give a different feel.  There is nothing terribly wrong with the J and J though, but there are several niggles. The chairs are  very close to the floor - think  Snow White and dwarves.  This meant the table in the bedroom was too high to enable any work to be done and this, coupled with no internet in the bedrooms, meant this hotel is hopeless for the business traveller. An iron and ironing board are available on request.  The heating was a single noisy radiator,…

title: Exquisite Gem in Florence
review: Thoroughly enjoyed our brief stay. Alberto at the desk was very accommodating and most helpful. The room was beautiful, clean and comfortable. Breakfast delightful!

title: Amazing find... Beautiful place in the heart of Florence
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Superb staff
review: Place is a hole in the wall that actually turns out to be a godsend.  Boutique style hotel with really nice people working there.  Very close to anywhere you want to walk to.  Best value we had in all of Italy.  thank you!

title: Awesome stay!
review: This is a nice , charming hotel (not cheap) in the city centre.  Best things about the hotel are:   -  Location: 7 minutes walking from the Duomo (cathedral), yet in a quiet street. Close to a nice little district with some good restaurants and shops, a popular market and the 19th century synagogue.  -  Staff: all of them are extremely kind and helpful, always ready to make your stay easy.  -  Building: an ancient nuns’ convent with original vaults and columns and a cosy inner patio.  -  Rooms:  some of them are facing the inner patio and are very peaceful. Our room was large and nicely decorated. Also, we had a room for the bath and another room for the toilette and the sink.  Issues that could be improved:   -  Breakfast is ok, but not excellent. Coffee is very good (very nice…

title: fairly nice boutique hotel
review: Stayed at the J and J for three nights in mid August.  Awesome stay.  Had a room with a king size bed overlooking a small court yard.  Only three rooms had access to the court yard which was great.  Absolutely beautiful stay, breakfast was decent but not the best but it is included in the price so why bother complain.  Only down side was the noisy air conditioner in the room, constant humming got to be very annoying after a few hours.  Washrooms are tight quarters and they should really have a soap dish in there not to have to leave the soap on the ground. Reception staff was quite nice and spoke english fluently.  Would stay and recommend this hotel to others.  Awesome local restaurant at the corner of the street called La Pentola dell'oro!

title: Some Kind of Wonderful
review: This hotel as noted by others is away from the maddening crowd. I found the steet that it is on tho a little shabby and the immediate area is of no interest at all.   We booked a double superior and were suprised to find no elevator.  As we climbed the stairs (63 steps) to our room I was ready to go to management to change it.  But once inside we were very happy with a HUGE loft style room with big balcony, 2 bathrooms, one with jacuzzi, the other shower, and views of florence from two sides. The furnishings were a little threadbear, and the service of the room only ok, turndown happended about 2 hours after the bed was made and soap and towels were forgotten 2 out of 5 days. Breakfast is served in a nice courtyard and was more than continental, with bacon and other hot meats.…

title: Not as great as we'd hoped
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Away from the crowds
review: The bedroom was ok. The bed fairly comfortable but bedding a bit shabby. There were no tea/coffee facilities in the bedroom and nowhere to relax apart from on the bed. The room was dark. The bathroom was the highlight of the accommodation with a huge bath and cascading shower. The breakfasts were absolutely shocking for the standard of accommodation. Stale bread rolls and pastries, dubious looking scrambled egg every other day. Yoghurts and cheese (?!). Bad coffee which was disappointing given we were in Italy. We wouldn't go back!

title: Cute and cosy
review: My Mum and I stayed at this hotel in February. We booked a junior suite using lastminute.com.  We arrived at the hotel at 8pm and were taken to our room. We were initially given a very large room on the ground floor (no.11 I think). The bathroom was very large and recently modernised (all marble fittings and very nice). Unfortunately, after staying one night in this room we had to be moved as the heating did not work. The following day we were given another room which was also a junior suite with a mezzanine. The mezzanine had room for a double and one single bed (see photos) and downstairs there was a small lounge and bathroom. Again, the bathroom had been recently modernised and was very nice.  We found the hotel staff to be very helpful and the breakfast was fine although a…

title: The perfect place for lovers...
review: Our third stop in Italy was Florence. We once again chose this hotel after reading reviews from TripAdvisor members.  The quaint, cosy setting particularly appealed to us. We had booked  a double deluxe room and were upgraded to a Jnr Suite. The room had all the charm we had been hoping for. A cosy loft style bedroom and ample lounge area downstairs. The bathroom was finished in stone and was a perfect, homely feeling hotel.  The hotel was only a short walk from the Duomo with supermarkets located  close by also.  The dining area was small and personal, with a common area with comfortable lounges and reading material for a quiet moment between seeing Florence's wonderful sites.  Highly recommend this hotel to any travelers passing though Florence!

title: This little jewel in Florence has style
review: After a long search between charming hotels in Florence, my choice was at J AND J... My bet was won! Since the hotel is a real jewel of Florence.. It's like discover a secret place.. you'll never imagine that in that street you'll find a place like this! The 19 rooms are all different one to the other since the hotel was a medieval coventry once.. The suites are enormous.. we slept in room N° 5 which was a deluxe and I really suggest it because it's special.. there is also a bathtube at the side of the giant bed! The only disappointment was the breakfast.. too small for a 4**** hotel.. Also the foreign service could be better...

title: Lovely stay at the J and J Hotel
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Intimate,Far from the madding crowd
review: This is a great little gem of the beaten track. All the attractions of Florence are within a 15mins walk and it feels less busy than in the centre of town where most of the hotels are located.  Looks and feels like a Boutique hotel with a little seating area in the front and the breakfast room overlooking a lovely courtyard. Staff were extremely helpful. I ordered a bouquet of roses for my partner to be in the room on arrival and they turned out to be the largest long stemmed red roses I had ever seen. Staff also made great restaurant recommendation. One evening we dined in a small restaurant in a part of town where most tourist wouldn't go. I must say it was one of the best meals we ever had with the antipasto platter being freshly prepared in front of us. The room we stayed in…

title: Best secret in Florence
review: After extensive searching for the perfect hotel in Florence, we found this intimate well located hotel, filled with charm and character which matched our needs. Situated in East Florence, the J&J is away from the hustle and bustle of the madding crowds, but within 5 to 20 mins walk of all the main tourist attractions and restaurants. The rooms are individually decorated and the air-conditioning is a must in the summer months. Be warned about the mosquitoes which are ubiquitous throughout Florence, and ensure that the plug-in insect repellent the hotel provides is on throughout the day. The breakfast is a little bit repetitive but the traveller must decide what their priorities are... (Ours certainly wasn't breakfast!) The hotel is within easy reach of rustic trattorias and for…

title: Hated the j and j
review: You will absolutely love this renovated convent in the heart of Florence. The rooms are fabulous and the staff couldn't be more gracious. The hotel is int the middle of all of the sights on a small street that oozes history and makes you feel as though you are in the middle of the 12th century.  Absolutely would recommend this for anyone wishing to have a great taste of Florence.

title: Paid for it, but didn't get to stay there
review: Selected it because of the high rating of the Michelin guide.  It was a big disappointment. Rooms are poor, not clean, shabby furniture, unpleasant bathrooms.  The staff was ok. They showed us several rooms since the hotel was quite empty. All looked poor.  Breakfast was a disgrace. A buffet full of nothing. Unbelievable how poor it was. We visited Florence many times and plan to visit it again. Will never stay at this hotel.

title: Charming and friendly
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: pros and cons for this hotel
review: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights on our honeymoon.  The place is described as being an old convent and it oozes the charm of old Florence.  The staff are friendly and excellent; all speak English and the front desk staff do so very well.  The warm buffet breakfast is alright.  Our room, I think, was not one of their best: narrow, extremely high-ceilinged with a not-so comfortable bed.  The bathroom was very nicely done: clean, sleek, modern, and roomy.  The neighborhood is authentically Florentine, set away from the big tourist draws but close enough to walk to them easily.  Nearby are plenty of non-touristy restaurants chock-full of real Florentines.  The price was right for a piece of old Florence.

title: Wonderful experience with the J&J!!
review: We had a large family suite here which though very roomy with nice bathroom was a bit on the musty side.The carpets looked as if they have been there for many, many years and were very dirty.The big problem was we were eaten alive by mosquitos during the night ! On the plus side...nice staff and good location on a quiet, convenient street.

title: Don't accept Room 1
review: I was so surprised to read negative reviews of the J&J.  I was somewhat nervous about staying here due to the paucity of reviews available, but was drawn in by the website and my pre-booking contact (via e-mail) with the staff.  We had such a wonderful experience with the hotel and every person with whom we dealt (especially Deepak - he deserves a raise!).  The J&J is located on a quiet street, yet close to pretty much everything.  We were able to walk virtually everywhere in Florence that we wanted to go.    We were a group of 7, and had 3 rooms, all double deluxe.  We found our rooms to be reasonably sized and loved the updated bathrooms.  The only tiniest bit of a complaint about our rooms would be the somewhat dim lighting in the bathroom.  Not a big deal.      The common…

title: Absolutely Awful!
review: The communal areas of this hotel are as in the website pictures - very attractively decorated and furnished. The service is friendly and the general location is good.   However, we were allocated Room 1 which was not a room whose pictures appear on the website. The bedroom is on a Mezzanine balcony within the room which has the attraction of being unsual but is accessed by a very narrow stone spiral stairway which is definitely not to be negotiated after a bottle of Chianti. The TV is upstairs in the bedroom rather than downstairs in the sitting area. But the biggest problem is that this ground floor room looks out on to the communal courtyard and the breakfast room. This means that it is impossible to open the curtains because of privacy and hence the room gets no natural…

title: Florence at its Best
review: Stop and stare at the beauty and symmetry of the Basilica of Santa Croce any time day or night. Unraveling around it are a number of architectural and artistic masterpieces, from the Synagogue to the Central National Library. As a hub for young people, the area gets busy with people who want to have fun: a continuous flow of tourists and locals become animated by songs and dances.

title: Super city centre hotel
review: The rooms are just as the pictures show.  The room and furniture are all wonderful.  I didn't know what to do with all the space.  The bathroom was almost half the size of the room.  I would recommed staying here.  Close to all the attractions.  Very close to great restaurants too.
